Rowena maintains a 2-hectare field in Surallah, South Cotabato. She manages a 1-hectare rice field and a 1-hectare corn field.  She is 25 years old with two children to support. Her eldest is 7 years old. She strives hard so that she can send her children to school to finish their studies.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, and asked for financial support for her business. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizers and seeds for the farm.

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Obiya East C Aber Betty Group

texts.en: Betty A. is representing a group of five members. She is 29 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are going to school and she has two other dependents who are schooling too. She has been running a business of selling used clothes for four years. She is using the loan to purchase used clothes for sale and increase the stock of her business. She is hardworking and encouraging. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes for sale

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 36 years old. He is married to Daisy Cherutich and they have three school-going children. He has been contracted by a local baker to distribute bread for him in Naivasha town. He uses his cycle to do so as the quantity is not that big. He has been doing this for the last three years.

He now wants to open up his own bakery and that is why he approached KADET, a Kiva partner, for this loan. He was told about KADET by his friend.  

After opening the bakery shop, he plans to grow it and be able to supply bread in the area on a large scale.

loans.use: Start-up capital to set up a small bakery

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. M. is 40 years old. He is married to a dentist and they have three children between fifteen and seven years old. They hope to give each of their children a good education at the university level.

His business is located at Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. He has been selling chains, spokes, bulbs, rings, oil, piston kit and other bicycle and motor bike spare parts. He sells to bicycle and motorbike riders mostly within Thika town.

James has been doing this business for five years now and has five employees. He says that his business is profitable and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and that some spare parts are not readily available. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

James will use his loan of 20000 KES to buy more spare chains, bulbs, and spokes. He hopes to be a distributor of spare parts in future. He is very hardworking, humble and jovial.

loans.use: To buy spokes, bulbs and spare chains.

loans.name: Sothea Soem Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sothea Soeme is from the village of Veay Chhneah, Takeo province. She is 32 years old and is the leader of a group consisting of four-members. Mrs. Sothea Soeme is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Sophy Soung, is construction worker. Sothea earns a small income that helps her family’s living standards. Mrs. Sothea Soeme is a hardworking woman. Aside from being a farmer, she is also a pig breeder at home. In order to support her pig breeding business, she is requesting for 8,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase piglets and pig food. Mrs. Sothea Soeme is a mother of three childrE.: two are students in the local school, while the youngest child is only 1 year old.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Symphorienne

texts.fr: Née en 1958, Z. Symphorienne vit depuis 24 ans à Fidjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Benin. Mariée à LOKO Gustave, agent au Ministère des Finances, Symphorienne est mère de 6 enfants qui sont scolarisés et dont un seul est encore à leur charge. Symphorienne vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Symphorienne exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, gobelets et bassines en plastique, sucre, piles etc.). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Symphorienne achète ses produits. Mais Symphorienne vend ses produits dans sa boutique à Fidjrossè. Symphorienne a fréquenté  jusqu'au primaire mais a commencé tôt son commerce. Symphorienne est une bonne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Symphorienne désire diversifier ses produits mais ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est la raison pour laquelle Symphorienne souhaite obtenir un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour mieux faire face à sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Née en 1958, Z. Symphorienne vit depuis 24 ans à Fidjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Benin. Mariée à LOKO Gustave, agent au Ministère des Finances, Symphorienne est mère de 6 enfants qui sont scolarisés et dont un seul est encore à leur charge. Symphorienne vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Symphorienne exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, gobelets et bassines en plastique, sucre, piles etc.). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Symphorienne achète ses produits. Mais Symphorienne vend ses produits dans sa boutique à Fidjrossè. Symphorienne a fréquenté jusqu'au primaire mais a commencé tôt son commerce. Symphorienne est une bonne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Symphorienne désire diversifier ses produits mais ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est la raison pour laquelle Symphorienne souhaite obtenir un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour mieux faire face à sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de savons, gobelets et bassines en plastique, sucre, piles etc.

loans.name: Gaveli

texts.en: Gaveli, 49, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She needs farming supplies to operate her rice field. However, she lacks capital for her rice farming business. She is seeking help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. by requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will enable her to provide the supplies needed for her farm. Perla is the mother of 6 children: the eldest is 29. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Beatriz M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casada mae de 4 filhos de 27, 23, 21, e 07 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe, nao continuou por falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Boane, nasceu no bairo Km 16 e construiu a sua residencia onde vive com a sua familia ate hoje. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 09 anos, trabalha das 8h as 17horas no mercado local, vende mais arroz, açucar, velas, temperos etc e nao possui nenhum empregado. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique ( sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que tambem sao clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz,temperos, sabao, velas e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade de mercadoria no seu estabelecimento e satifazer a demanda da sua clientela. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.200.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 8.7000.00.mt e 10.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para  a construção de um novo estabelecimento comercial e oferecer melhor comodidade aos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Beatriz M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children who are 27, 23, 21, and 7 years old. The youngest attends school. She only finished the 4th grade due to her parents' lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else. She has never left Boane. She was born in the Km 16 neighborhood, where she still lives today with her family. She has had her own business for more over 9 years. She works from 8am to 5pm in the local market, where she sells rice, sugar, candles, condiments/spices, etc. She does not have any employees. She earns about 5,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for her family's expenses. She even saves some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her 6th loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy goods (rice, condiments/spices, soap, candles, etc.) in order to increase her business's supply and satisfy her customers' demands. The previous loans were for 5,200 MZN, 8,000 MZN, 8,000 MZN, 8,700 MZN, and 10,000 MZN, all for the same activity. In the future, she would like to request more loans in order to build a new business establishment and to improve its convenience for her customers.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell essential goods (rice, sugar, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Melanie is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a business selling firewood in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 58-year-old woman, married, with 5 children. Her children are doing well in school and business. She sells household and gift items like cooking pots, plates and cups. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience to attract and retain more customers. She hopes to grow her business. Her greatest challenge in her business is funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She is a hard-working woman. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 170,000. She will use these funds to purchase more household and gift items. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more household and gift items to sell.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia G. is from the village of Balik-balik, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 43 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Melodia prepares and sells "Binangkal" (a deep fried dough delicacy) in the community. She also operates a Sari-sari Store in the local community. Melodia has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Melodia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melodia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials for the production of "Binangkal" to sell. Melodia is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Melodia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital.

loans.name: Alice Ligare

texts.en:
Alice Ligare E. is married to Ezekiel Nyambane and they have three children. Evans, who is the first-born, just joined secondary school this year; while Samsom, the second born, is in 6th grade of primary school. Jenipher, who is the last born, is in kindergarten. They live in Nyalenda area in Kisumu city.
 
Alice has been running the pharmacy store for the past four years and her business has been doing well. She has managed to access two loans from Kadet Ltd., which she paid well without any difficulties. She is a client with a good credit history with us. She is looking for Kiva lenders to enable her to get a loan which will help her buy more medicine for her chemist business.

She hopes to own a big chemist in the future and have contracts with Insurance companies. This will enable her to increase her clientele, which in return will boost her business. She also hopes that when her first son finishes high school, he will take medical training so as to take up the business and expand it.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen loves clothes and that is why she sells used clothes to make a living in Sapele, Delta state. She loves this business because she has the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has 3 children and she is happy that they are excelling in school. Her husband is a mechanic and he also supports the home. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skills to attract more customers to her business. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana L. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Emeliana is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Emeliana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Emeliana sells both food & daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emeliana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Emeliana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emeliana is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emeliana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rutheda

texts.en:
Mrs Rutheda E. is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has a business called a LAPAKANAY. This is made of abaka and they are the suppliers for handicraft businesses. She earns approximately 4000PHP a month.

Rutheda joined PMPC to gain access for financial support and to engage in other business activities. She has a loan of 3000PHP, taken from PMPC and it is the 1st cycle upon availing. This loan has been used as additional capital for her LAPAKANAY project.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her lapakanay business.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is a LAPO client with good repayment record. (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She sells groceries and foodstuffs like beans, rice, melon, tomatoes, milk. Beauty hopes for business expansion and she is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell and to increase her profit. Beauty is happily married with 7 children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel G. K. is 25 years old and married with one child aged two years old.

Daniel has been providing bicycle transport services to the local people for the last two years. His business is located at Kimbo, a busy market in Thika, Kenya. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples.

Daniel says that his business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

Daniel will use his loan of 15000 KES to start a vegetable shop to improve his living standards. He hopes to be a big business man. He is very hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To start up a new vegetable shop.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith C. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Judith is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. Judith is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: K. Louise est née le 25 août 1960 à Allada, dans le département de l'atlantique au Bénin. Louise vit depuis 5 ans à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à LATCHOUKPO Bienvenu, un agent de la douane à la retraite, Louise est mère de 4 enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Louise a également un autre enfant à charge. Seulement quelques uns des enfants sont scolarisés. Louise vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Louise mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (maïs, couscous, conserves de tomate, savon, riz etc.). Louise achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Mais c'est à son domicile que Louise effectue la vente de ses produits. Louise a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire mais exerce son activité depuis bientôt 20 ans. Louise a déjà obtenu 2 crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de renforcer son activité, Louise souhaite obtenir un troisième concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Louise K. was born August 25, 1960 in Allada, in Benin’s Department of the Atlantic. For the past five years she has been living in the Agla neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Bienvenu LATCHOUKPO, a retired customs agent, and is the mother of four children. She also has another child under her care, and only some of the children are still in school. Louise lives with her husband and children, and the couple share household expenses. To assist her husband, Louise sells a variety of products (corn, couscous, canned tomatoes, soap, rice, etc.) from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Louise has attended school up to secondary level, but has been in business for almost 20 years. She has already been granted two previous loans from ALIDé, which were fully repaid. She is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé, to increase her working capital and bolster her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, coucous, soap, rice, canned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. is married to Kizito Juma and they are blessed with one child. She lives in Shanzu and her business is in Mikoshoroni area in Mombasa. Grace operates a grocery store and mainly sells vegetables to her neighbors. Her business is doing well. She has been operating it for the last three years.

Grace joined KADET recently and is borrowing her first loan of 20,000. She intends to use the money to add more vegetables stock and to also do some renovations to her grocery store.

Her dream is to become a distributor to various retailers in the area.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and to do renovations to her store.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly V. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Merly is married and has one school-aged child. Merly owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merly is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Mila is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells different goods like vegetables, eggs and more in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mila is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Emmily

texts.en:
Emmily M., a 31-year-old mother of three children, is married to Daniel Rau. Emmily is a paraffin vendor at Mikoroshoni in Mombasa. Her clients are predominantly the area residents who are also her neighbors. She has been operating the business for one year and it has been doing well.

Emmily was introduced to KADET by a friend and is now accessing her first loan. She plans to purchase paraffin stock wholesale from Mombasa and later resell to the area households of Mikoroshoni.

Emmily operates in a semi-permanent store and hopes to expand and open up a permanent store to sell the paraffin.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin stock from Mombasa town.

loans.name: Khoja Abdul Matin Group

texts.en:
This is the two-member K. Abdul Matin group, led by 43-year-old Nadeya, the mother of six children, all attending school. She wants to take a loan for her tailoring business in order to buy necessary resources.

K. Abdul Matin, a hard-working man who aspires to a comfortable life and educated children, is seeking a loan for his metal shop.

They have requested a group loan of of 20,000 Afghani with which they can expand their businesses and better support their families and make a better future for themselves.

loans.use: To buy new machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: Née en 1984, A. Jocelyne vit depuis 10 ans à Fidjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOUKPE Hyppolite, un employé de la SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasserie),  Jocelyne est mère de 2 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Jocelyne vit seule avec ses enfants. Mais le couple se partage les dépenses familiales. Pour supporter sa famille, Jocelyne exerce comme activité principale, la vente de produits de toilette (savons de lessive et de toilette, détergents) et de manière secondaire la vente de pâtes alimentaires. Jocelyne effectue l'achat de ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Jocelyne vend ses produits non loin de son domicile. Jocelyne a été à l'école jusqu'au secondaire mais exerce son activité depuis 4 ans. Jocelyne a obtenu auprès de ALIDé 3 crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l'optique de renforcer son activité et de diversifier son activité, Jocelyne sollicite un quatrième concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jocelyne was born in 1984 and has lived for the past 10 years in Fidjrosse, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Doukpe Hyppolite, an employee of Sibebra (Beninese Brewers Society). Jocelyne is the mother of two school-aged children and lives alone with her children. The couple, however, share the family living expenses. To support her family through her main business activity, Jocelyne sells toiletry items such as dish soaps, bath soaps, and detergents and as a second activity she sells basic doughs. Jocelyne buys her supplies of these products in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin and resells her products not far from her home. Jocelyne has attend secondary school and has been in this busines for four years. She has made three loans through ALIDE which have been repaid in full. With the intention of strengthening and diversifying her business, Jocelyne is requesting her fourth business loan from ALIDE.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toiletry items such as dish soaps, bath soaps, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou F. est une femme de 55 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont les 2 sont majeurs et autonomes, quant aux 5 autres ils sont sous sa charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 8 ans et demi et a été 17 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêts. Avec son crédit elle développe un petit élevage de poulets de chaire. Avec cette activité elle compte réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et de prétendre à l'achèvement de la construction de samaison en dur.
texts.en:
Oumou F. is 55 years old, married and mother of seven children, of whom two are adults and live on their own, and five are still under her care. She has been a member of the Wango “Banc Villageois” loan group for eight and a half years, and was granted 17 successive loans. These loans have helped her develop a small business raising chickens. Her foreseen profits will be used to increase her savings and to finish constructing a solid home.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Иноятов Абдуазиз проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, работает в компании сотовой связи МЛТ. Сам Абдуазиз торгует в магазине. Он в основном продает сувиниры. В этой деятельности более 3 лет. Абдуазиз имеет высшее образование. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. увеличение ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Abduaziz I. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife works at the MLT cellular communications company. Abduaziz is involved in retail sales at a store. He primarily sells souvenirs. He has been in this business for over 3 years. Abduaziz has a higher education. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. expand his merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette G. est mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge, elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle fait partie des membres promoteurs du Banc Villageois de WANGO (depuis 12ans et demi)et a eu 25 fois de suite à bénéficier de prêts. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, de chaussures, de bijoux etc. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de leur famille.
texts.en:
Maguette G. is 52 years old, married and mother of eight children, all under her care. She has been a member of the Wango “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past 12 ½ years, and has been granted 25 successive loans. She runs a small business selling fabric, shoes, jewelry, etc. Her objective is to assist her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Rabeka Khalid Group

texts.en:
Rahella is the group leader of Rabeka Khalid group which consists of five members who each want to expand and progress their business.

Rahella, who is 50 years old, wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business.

Adella and Rabeka want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They work hard to earn money for the support of their families’ requirements. They need to buy new sewing machines for their shop because they have lots of problems with the old ones while sewing. Besides that, they want to hire a student to support them in their business and to enlarge their business.

Khaleda wants to take a loan for her husband’s carpentry business. He wants to expand and progress his business and buy stock for his shop to complete his stock and for his future because he wants to see his business have more success.

A. Khalid wants to take a loan for his general store to purchase additional inventory and to expand his business, too. He is confident that through the loan he can work in a good way and can earn more money.

Together, they requested a group loan of 70,000 Afghani. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Billy

texts.en: Billy is 40 years old, married and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. His youngest child is four years old.  A hard-working man, he sells phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards at retail prices to his customers, and with his profits he hopes to expand his business in the future. Billy is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and phone accessories to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 29 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years of age. Fidele lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. His wife is a full-time housewife.

This butcher shop business chosen by Fidele is profitable because he has good marketing skills and has many years of experience in this field. Since 2001 his business has been open from eight in the morning to eight in the evening every day except Sunday.

Fidele is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to grow his business through purchasing great quantities of meat for sale. This will allow him to earn more profits.

Fidele, above all, plans to provide all the needs of his family, to save money for his child’s school fees, and to create another business activity for his wife; these are his targets.

loans.use: To purchasing great quantities of cow meat to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate, 32 years old and single, lives in Benin City.  A hard-working lady, Kate is a hair dresser who also sells hair accessories in order to make additional profit.  She makes lovely Nigerian and western hair styles for her customers. Kate has a good relationship with LAPO and hopes to expand her business through a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more hair accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair accessories to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet has a good relationship with LAPO. She renders catering services to people in her community. She also rents plates, spoons, coolers, and forks to people that have various occasions to entertain their guests. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is always happy when she is rendering her catering services. She is a widow with seven children. Income from this business enables her to sponsor her children’s education and feeding. Janet is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more plates, pots and serving spoons. Janet is 67 years old and she lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plates, pots and serving spoons

loans.name: Chidi

texts.en: Chidi is a businessman. He sells textbooks to his customers at retail prices. He hopes to own a big bookstore in the future. He loves this business because it gives him the opportunity to meet one-on-one with his customers. Chidi is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more textbooks to sell. He sells for long hours to enable him put food on his table to feed his children. He is 45 years old and married with five children. His eldest child is 10 years old. He is always happy when he sees his children excelling in school. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 34 years old and the owner of a business that bottles mineral water.  She is single and owns her own home in the General Diaz neighborhood.  Laura relies on basic amenities to run her business.  Thanks to the credit she obtained through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, Laura has purchased supplies for her water-bottling plant, and has been able to boost her income.

Now, her income has increased and her clients are increasingly satisfied with the excellent service and high quality water she offers in her area.

Laura is thankful for the loans she has received through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva as they have helped her boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her water business

loans.name: Fatima Adoke

texts.fr: Née le 16 avril 1966 à Porto-Novo, capitale admistrative du Bénin, F. Fatima Adoke vit à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Fatima Adoke est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.  Fatima Adoke vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Fatima Adoke exerce comme activité principale la vente de tissus et accessoirement, la vente de bijoux et de chaussures. Fatima Adoke effectue l'achat de ses produits à  Dantopka, marché international du Bénin. Mais Fatima Adoke vend ses produits par distribution et de manière ambulante. Fatima Adoke n'a jamais fréquenté l'école mais possède 30 années d'expériences dans son domaine. Fatima Adoke est une bonne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Fatima Adoke désire se faire beaucoup plus de revenus pour s'acheter une parcelle, c'est la raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born April 16, 1966 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Fatima Adoke F. lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom have had schooling. Fatima Adoke lives with her husband and children, and shares with her husband the various household expenses. Fatima Adoke sells fabrics as her main activity, with shoewear and jewelry as a second sales activity. She buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and distributes them to her customers as an itinerant merchant. She has never attended school, but has accumulated 30 years of experience in her line of business. Fatima Adoke is a regular client of ALIDé, and duly reimburses her loans. She needs to significantly increase her income so she can buy a plot of land, which is why she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy facrics and jewelry

loans.name: Evans Wangila

texts.en:
Evans W. is a 40-year-old widower with four children who are all in primary school. He repairs bicycles in Chekulo, a small town in the Western Province, and has been in this business for the last 10 years. Evan’s wife died and left him with the responsibility of looking after the children single-handedly, which is a great task for him.

Evans is taking out his second loan from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first one. He is thankful for the Kiva lenders who assisted him. He is now looking for a Kiva lender to help him get another loan to enable him to buy more bicycle spare parts and inventory for his bicycle repair shop. This will enable him to improve his business by repairing all the bicycles that are awaiting spare parts. 

He hopes to use the profits made to pay school fees for his children, pay rent and for family upkeep since his children are dependent on him. Evans also hopes to diversify into the bicycle spare parts business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya T. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 12 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 25 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés. Elle est également membre du comité de gestion dudit Banc Villageois. Elle fait du commerce de produits halieutiques (huitres, poissons séchés, poissons fumés etc.) et d'huile de palme. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Rokhaya T. is 52 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” loan group in Wango for 12 ½ years and has been granted 25 loans, all of which were handled well. She is also part of the management committee of the Banc Villageois. She retails seafood products (oysters, dried and smoked fish, etc.) and palm-nut oil. Her earnings allow her to assist her husband in managing household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is 45 years old and lives in her own house in Pilar in the San Francisco neighborhood.  She relies upon basic amenities for her well being.  

Clotilde sells clothing for a living.  She has a well-formed client base in her city and in the interior part of the country.  She offers a variety of types of clothing of varying qualities.

She is seeking a loan to purchase clothing for her business.  She is thankful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that it has given her.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 56 years old and is from Esicharai in Kakamega. She is married to Reuben Lumwanji and they have three children who are in college.

Rose has a retail shop and is running out of things in her shop - thus the need of acquiring a loan to help her add more stock. She has taken two previous loans from KADET and this will be her third. She is looking for Kiva lenders to assist her with funds to be able to buy a sack of sugar, cooking fat, paraffin (kerosene), three crates of soda and washing basins to add to her existing stock.

Rose has been running her business for some years and out of it she was able to pay school fees for her children until they completed high school. She has a huge clientele since her shop is the only one around the neighborhood and so she faces no competition. 

Rose hopes to diversify into a hotel (restaurant) business in the future and even buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana O. cooks and sells waakye (rice with beans) at Abura near Cape Coast. She has received senior high education. She is married and has three children and her husband is a mechanic.

Juliana has been selling waakye for some time now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business and to further her children’s education.

To prepare waakye, Juliana gets her beans, rice and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans till they become a little tender, adds the colored leaves to give the beans and the boiling water a wine color then she adds her rice to get a mixture of the rice and beans in the water. She cooks it until it becomes tender to eat.

Waakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (smoked cow hide), gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), salad with pepper sauce, tomatoes sauce, and fish of any kind and meat of your choice.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.en:
Rigoberto is 35 years old and lives in his own house in Pilar in the Ytororo neighborhood. He owns a business that collects waste from houses in the neighborhood.

Rigoberto has a well-formed client base within Pilar and the surrounding area and uses horse-drawn carts to collect the garbage. This is the third time Pilar has worked with Fundación Paraguaya and, in the past, has been able to boost his income as a result of the loans.

Rigoberto is thankful for Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that they afford him.

loans.use: To improve his garbage-collection carts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 43 years old and married with seven children. She lives with her family in Benin City, Edo state. Her husband sells building materials to support their home. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. 

She sells firewood at retail prices to her customers. Philomena hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is a 20-year-old single lady. She owns a beauty salon in the Barisheba area in Mikoroshoni, Mombasa. Her business has been in existence for the last four years and is doing well. B. says that most of her clients are the young residents living in the area.

Esther is a member of Nadhani Nitafaulu SHG in KADET Mombasa. She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by an existing member of the group and this is her first time borrowing. She intends to use this money to purchase some beauty products and hair chemicals for the salon. She also hopes to do minor repairs and fixes in her salon to make it more appealing to her clients.

Her dream is to see her business grow and she hopes to open more beauty salons later.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair chemicals and to perform minor repairs in her salon

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 46 years old, married with 4 children who are 17, 20, 22, and 25 years old. Virginie has been in the business of renting out wedding clothes for about 10 years. Virginie is happy in her business because it helps her to take care of her family. The hours of her business are from 5 AM to 7 PM every day.

Virginie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing some other styles of wedding clothes. Those new styles are modern styles, and she hopes that once she adds those new styles to her business, she will attract many young people who are ready for marriage and she hopes that once they are ready to get married, they will come to rent clothes. Virginie, by using this Kiva loan, expects to see an increase in sustainability in her business.

loans.use: Additional wedding clothes to rent out

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old, married, with 2 children who are 15 and 18 years old. Josephine and her family live in Kayonza, situated in the eastern province of Rwanda. Josephine has been in the business of selling cosmetic products including soaps, body lotion etc. Josephine has been doing this business as a wholesaler. This is her 13th successful year in this business which she starts early in the morning and continues until late in the evening.

After this long period of experience in her business, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more cosmetic goods. If her business keeps its sustainability, she hopes to start wholesaling bags, new clothes for women, and some other products requested by her customers. Through this Kiva loan, Josephine has a hope for the future.

loans.use: Additional cosmetic products for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro viviendas de la ciudad de  Encarnación  surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación.
 Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser :  venta de mercaderías comestibles, despensa, kiosko,  venta de ropas,  peluquería, fabricación y venta de uniformes de colegio   etc. 
Cada una realiza una actividad independiente para generar sus propios ingresos, así como la señora Felicita A. quien se dedica a la confección de ropas de alta costura para damas, hace vestidos para novias, quinceañeras,  trajes de noches y otros, sus clientes están muy satisfecho con los trabajos de Doña Felicita. El crédito los destinara para la compra de sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
This Group ("Women united for success") from the neighborhood San Pedro in the city Encarnación was set up when one of its members contacted the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya. All the ladies perform productive activities such as selling food products, running a convenience store or a newspaper kiosk, selling clothes, operating a hairdressing salon, tailoring and selling school uniforms, etc. Each has an independent activity to generate her own income. So Ms Felicita A. tailors high fashion dresses for ladies, bridal gowns, dresses for quinceañeras (galas for girls' 15th birthdays), evening dresses and others. Doña Felicita's customers are very satisfied with her work. She will use her loan share to buy work tools and materials.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, yarns, needles, scissors and buttons

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells cassava dough popularly known in Nigeria as “akpu”, “fufu” or “santana”. She has been in this business for a long time, and this business gives her joy. Cassava dough is obtained from fermented cassava and it can be eaten with any Nigerian soup. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. Her major challenge in her business is funds, and she hopes to overcome that challenge. She is happy because during the holidays, her children assist her with sales. She hopes to expand her business.

Mary is married with 6 children. Her children attend school and she hopes to give them quality education. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Kiné

texts.fr: Kiné G. est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 6 ans. Elle est vendeuse de friperie, elle achète des ballots de friperies par catégorie, habits pour enfants, pour hommes, pour dames etc. et les revend dans son quartier et au marché. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par rapport à la dépense quotidienne et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Kiné G. is married and the mother of four children. She is 30 years old, and has been a member of the « Banc Villageois » loan group of Wango for the past six years. She retails second-hand clothing, by first buying bales of used clothes in different categories (children’s clothes, men’s, women’s, etc.), and then reselling them in her neighbourhood and at the market. Her objective is to assist her husband with the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Carol Noemi

texts.es:
La Sra Carol P. es casada posee casa propia una sola hija de 2 años. Es microempresaria es propietaria de un local comercial ubicado en el nuevo circuito comercial Plazita Municipal Bloque 2 local 51 de la Ciudad de Encarnación. 
La misma solicito el crédito a un plazo de 12 meses lo cual se le concedió y lo uso para incrementar sus  mercadería , la misma cuenta con 8 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela y un buen  ingreso. Actualmente aumentaron las ventas en la zona de ENCARNACION por ser zona turística.
texts.en:
Ms. Carol P. is married, owns her house, and has a 2 year old daughter. She is a small business owner and owns a shop located in the new commercial circuit of Plazita, municipal block 2 local 51 in the city of Encarnación. Currently, they are increasing sales in the zone of Encarnacion by making it a tourist zone. She is asking for a loan with a 12 month term which she will use to increase her merchandise. She has a similar loan of 8 months that has allowed her to build a very good clientele and have a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying medicine, acetaminophen, repellants, antacids, and various other drugs.

loans.name: Rebeka

texts.en:
Rebeka is 48 years old, married with 5 children who are 11, 18, 20, 21 and 25 years old.  Rebeka also takes care of two dependents who are 12 and 14 years old.  Rebeka and her family live in the Ngoma, a region of Rwamagana situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  Here, Rebeka sells a variety of drinks.  This is her 15th successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from morning until late in the evening.

Rebeka is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through adding more drinks for sale.  With these additional drinks, Rebeka hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to reinvest in her business so that her business can keep growing.  If her plan is successful, Rebeka with the sustainability of her business, she will create some other sources of income as well as creating more jobs to the people of her community.

loans.use: Additional drinks for sale

loans.name: Janemary

texts.en: Jane is a tailor who makes dresses and sells clothing materials.  She is a widowed lady who is 45 years old and has three children.  Jane is a member of Faulu Kenya and has previously taken two loans from the MFI.  She hopes to open another tailoring shop in the future and it is for this reason that she is requesting Kes. 50,000 to expand her business.  She says that she is hard-working.

loans.use: To boost the business

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia R. D. Y. posee una clínica D. rehabilitación que lleva el nombre D. Clínica San Carlos posee antigüedad en el ramo.

Su clínica esta ubicada en el barrio San Miguel del distrito D. Cambyreta y posee casa propia en el barrio San Isidro D. la cuidad D. Encarnación vivienda en la cual aun no vive ya que esta reformando.  

El destino del crédito es para reformas en su D. la clinica para porner en condiciones la sala D. consultas y así birndar una mejor antencion a los pacientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Celia R. D. Y. owns a rehabilitation clinic called Clinica San Carlos, a long and well-established clinic in this field. Her clinic is located in the neighborhood of San Miguel in the district of Cambyreta. She owns her own house in the neighborhood of San Isidro in the city of Encarnacion, an area that is improving. The loan will be used to improve the consultation room and thus proviD. better care to the patients.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for construction such as bricks and paint.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his parents and 2 brothers. He is the one who supports his family with his business. He has been working as a farmer for the past 10 years. He cultivates parsley, zucchini, and tomatoes on his land.

Today, Khodor is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy seeds and fertilizers for the next harvest.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yahya K. est un jeune célibataire âgé de 28 ans et qui  après l’école coranique suivît un métier de tapissier sous l’influence de son père. Il gère maintenant  sa propre entreprise de tapisserie  au quartier cité Senghor de Thiès. Il fabrique ainsi des meubles sur commandes ou même pour l’exposer à la vente. 
Ce jeune tapissier avec une expérience de 11 ans dans le métier, souhaitait s’approvisionner en matières premières pour  finir  une confection de meubles. C’est ainsi qu’il demande auprès de la caisse Jammi Xaleyi de U-IMCEC Thiès un crédit de 500 000 FCFA. 
Avec ce montant il pourra acheter des tissus, éponges et bois nécessaires et constituer avec  le reste  un fond de roulement pour assurer  le bon fonctionnement de ses activités. Il est dans son entreprise avec ses 3 apprentis qu’il forme également pour le métier de tapissier.
texts.en:
Mr. Yahya K. is a 28-year-old bachelor who, through his father’s influence, learned the upholstery trade after leaving the Coranic school. He now manages his own upholstery business in the Cité Senghor area of Thiès. He also makes furniture to order or even displays it for sale. This young upholsterer has accumulated 12 years’ experience in the business, and now needs raw materials to complete a furniture order. This is why he has requested a loan of 500,000 FCFA from the Jammi Xaleyi credit loan branch of U-IMCEC in Thiès. With this loan, he will buy the necessary fabric, sponges and wood and use the remainder as working capital to ensure the smooth functioning of his activities. He runs his business with three apprentices who are also being trained as upholsterers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials and establsih a working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa S. is from Tacuara, 5 km from the city of San Estanislao.  She is single and 37 years old.  Teresa has been selling gold and silver jewelry and perfume for 15 years.  She travels on a motorcycle, selling her merchandise throughout the town to her established client base.  Teresa's dream is to have her own retail space in the city of Santani, as the majority of her customers are from there.  This would allow her to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase her own retail space

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kamene is 41 years old and a single mother of three children who attend school.  She has been selling men’s wear for fifteen years.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, she plans to take out her first loan of Kes. 20,000. She plans to add more stock of trousers.  She hopes to open her own boutique in the future.  She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To add more stock of trousers

loans.name: Ciriano

texts.en: Cipriano F. is 51 years old and is from San Estanislao.  He runs a business that rents out tables and chairs for parties and other social events, and he owns a truck to transport the equipment.  Cipriano's wife makes decorations for birthdays and weddings.  Cipriano owns three rooms that he rents out.  He now wants to build a stage that he can rent out along with the party rooms.

loans.use: Build a stage

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 52 years old, a widow with 5 children. She lives with her children in Benin City, Edo State. Life as a widow has been challenging for her. She sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Doris hopes to own a boutique in the future. She also hopes to grow her business. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She is itching for expansion in her business and improvement in her family's living conditions. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Gladys Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Mabel R. R. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada desde hace varios años, tiene 3 hijas que dependen económicamente de los padres, y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio Jardín Cambyreta.

La señora Gladys es propietaria de una Heladeria que posee desde hace varios años en su domicilio y ademas realiza servicio de eventos, tiene mucha cliente la de zona. Su esposo también es muy trabajador y le apoya económicamente. Gracias a la actividades que realiza la señora Gladys ha podido salir adelante, dar una buena educación a sus hijas y solventar los gastos del hogar.

El destino del crédito es para realizar la compra de manteles, sillas, mesas y otros para su heladeria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Mabel R. R. is 44 years old, has been married for many years and has 3 daughters that are economically dependent on their parents. They live in their own house located in Barrio Jardin Cambyreta. Mrs. Gladys is the owner of an ice-cream shop that she has owned for many years in her home. She also provides catering for events. She has many customers in the zone. Her husband also works hard and supports her financially. Thanks to the activities that she performs, Mrs. Gladys has been able to get ahead, give her daughters a good education and keep up with the household expenses. The loan will be used to purchase tablecloths, chairs, tables and other items for the ice-cream shop.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy table cloths, tables and chairs

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Salah has been working as a blacksmith and as a taxi driver since 2002. Salah is an active man who does his best to improve his family's financiA. conditions. He decided to start working as a blacksmith because he had gained experience and likes it. As for his taxi, it allows him to increase his income and continue working after he is done with his work as a blacksmith.

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase iron for his work and do some maintenance work on his car. This is his fourth loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to continually improve his work as a blacksmith, and also his financiA. situation.

Salah is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to have all the required tools. Salah decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job which allows him to set his own schedule and work as a taxi driver. In future, he plans to keep on improving his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase iron for his work and do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Angel Ramon Ayala

texts.en: Angel Ramon Ayala Ganoa is from San Estanislao and lives in the Tacuara neighborhood.  He is 38 years-old and married to Marele Enriqueta Vergara Portillo, who is 33 years-old.  They have one child together.  Angel owns a bakery which he operates out of his home.  He has an established client base and earns a good income.  Angel has good personal and professional references and is a hard worker.  He would like to build a larger room to house his bakery.

loans.use: To build a larger bakery.

loans.name: Hayssam

texts.en:
Hayssam is a 37 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hayssam has been working in construction since 1998. Hayssam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. Hayssam has been a microcredit client for five years and has always paid on time.

Hayssam is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network of clients and had some financial issues. He decided on his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to expand his business and improve his work quality.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 49 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ibrahim has been working as a car painter since 2003. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is the fourth cycle and he has always paid on time.

Ibrahimi is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had some financial difficulties in order to buy all the necessary tools. He decided on his business because he wanted to have  independent work. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint.

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en:
Zahi is a 35 year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Zahi has been working as a motorcycle repairer. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. When he first started, he had to make himself known to the public. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his work. Zahi has been a microcredit client for five years and has always paid on time.

His previous loans have allowed him to improve his work and purchase spare parts. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business by selling motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Chinwe

texts.en: Chinwe is 38 years-old and married with five children. Her youngest child is eight years old. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports the home. She sells used sarongs and lace at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years. Chinwe hopes to expand her business with the Kiva loan. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to enable her to purchase more used sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 61-year-old man who lives with his wife in Saida, southern Lebanon.

Moustafa has been selling fruits and vegetables for over twenty-five years and sells depending on the season. He is very well known in his region because his shop has always been there, and his clients have been the same for over twenty years; he also sells a good quality of products and is welcoming. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others from his region.

Moustafa requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. He has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to purchase merchandise and increase his stock.

When he first started his business, Moustafa didn’t face difficulties excepting that he didn’t have a lot of cash to diversify his merchandise. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for shop

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 46-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. He has owned a small coffee shop since 2000.

Fouad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to change the decor of his coffee shop as well as to purchase more merchandise. This is first time that he has requested a loan.

Fouad is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and they feel comfortable coming to his shop. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all he needed for his shop. He decided doing his business because he learned it since he was young.

In future, Fouad plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To change his coffee shop decor and purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 59-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Khaled has been working as a furniture repairer for over thirty years and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loans allowed him to improve his work, as well as his financial situation.

Khaled decided on doing his business because he had experience. When he first started his work he had some difficulties building networking. For the future, he hopes that he will keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 36-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Jihad has been working as a blacksmith for more than ten years. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as the fact that he likes his work. When he first started his work, he had some difficulties purchasing all the required tools because he had a small budget, but he did his best to improve his working conditions and made the necessary money  to purchase his machines.

Jihad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan allowed him to improve his work, as well as his financiA. situation.

For the future, Jihad hopes that he will keep on improving his work, as well as his financiA. situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
Faysal is a 34-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their child.

Faysal has owned and operated a grocery store for over ten years where he sells candies, soft drinks and more. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. With this loan he plans to diversify his merchandise and increase his stock so that he can answer his clients’ needs. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan allowed him to increase his products.

Faysal decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. When he first started his work, he had some financial issues because he couldn’t afford to buy and offer a big quantity of merchandise. For the future, he hopes that he will keep on expanding his work, as well as improving his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca Careaga is from San Estanislao and lives in the Colonel Vincente Mongelos neighborhood.  She is 55 years old and married to Julio Candia Portillo, who is 48.  They have two children together who are grown up and work on their own.  Francisca runs a retail store out of her home which she has named "Las Perlas" (The Pearl).  She has an established client base, good personal and professional references, and earns a good income.  She is very hardworking.  Now, Francisca would like to purchase another vehicle to use in selling her merchandise around the town.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle to use in selling her merchandise around the town

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 39-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their four children. She has a universal degree and owns a grocery where she sells goods like soft drinks, cookies and other items.

Rima requested a loan from Al Majmoua mainly in order to purchase a refrigerator, stands, and some goods for her grocery. This is the first time that Rima has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

This shop came from her parents and this gave her the opportunity to start up with this business. Now she’s willing to enlarge it. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business ten years ago, she had some financial issues but she carried on working in the shop and now she’s making it bigger.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, stands, and goods for her grocery

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi, a 50-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their ten children, is a farmer who owns livestock, has milking cows, and buys yogurt and milk. Mahdi has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase more livestock for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

Mahdi is speciA. in his work due to his honesty, expertise, and cleanliness. His clients are the industries, his friends and neighbors. He decided on this business because of family members. In the future, he plans on expanding his production by having more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his work.

loans.name: Béatrice Jeanne

texts.fr: Née le 17 janvier 1975 au TCHAD, pays voisin du Bénin, A. Béatrice Jeanne vit à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à BOSSOUDAHO Hubert, un transitaire, Béatrice Jeanne est mère de six enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Béatrice Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Agla. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Béatrice Jeanne a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a près de 13 ans que Béatrice Jeanne vend à son domicile, des produits congelés. Parallèlement à cette activité, Béatrice Jeanne vend du maïs et du charbon de bois. Béatrice Jeanne s'approvisionne au marché de Houègbo et achète les produits congelés au CDPA (une entreprise de vente de produits congelés). Béatrice Jeanne a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué les remboursements. Béatrice Jeanne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la nombreuse demande des clients.
texts.en:
Born on January 17, 1975 in Tchad, a country adjacent to Benin, Béatrice Jeanne A. lives in the Agla neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Hubert BOSSOUDAHO, a forwarding agent, Béatrice Jeanne is the mother of six children, who are all attending school. She lives with her husband and children in Agla, and shares family expenses with her husband. Béatrice Jeanne attended school up to secondary level. For the past 13 years, Béatrice Jeanne has been selling frozen products from her home. As a side business, she also sells corn and charcoal. She gets her supplies from the Honègbo market and buys frozen products at the CDPA (a business that sells frozen products). Béatrice Jeanne has previously been granted two loans from ALIDé, both well reimbursed. She is now requesting a third loan to bolster her activity and better respond to her customers’ numerous requests.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 100-kilo bags of corn and frozen products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 57-year-old widow with seven children ranging in age from 13 to 37 years old. Her youngest child, along with three of her grandchildren, are currently attending school. She operates a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over ten years. She earns most of her income by selling milk and maize to local vendors, and is now wishing to expand her poultry farm. She says that the main challenge she faces is the expensive drugs necessary for her dairy farming. She is also strained for farmland, as a swamp nearby makes things difficult in the rainy season.

Elizabeth requested this loan, her second through Juhudi Kilimo, for Kes. 15,000 to upgrade her poultry farming operations. She says that the extra income from this loan will help boost the family's standard of living, and she even regrets being so late among her peers to apply for these small loans. In the future, Elizabeth would like to have progressed over time to a better standard of living, and she hopes to help educate all of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To upgrade her poultry farm

loans.name: Matín

texts.es:
El señor Martín G. el mismo es casado con casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar es de la zona de Edelira 60   sus tres hijos estudian en la escuela Nacional de Edelira.
 El cliente es propietario de  una carpintería denominada CARPINTERIA  G.  cuenta con 10 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos fabricando muebles sumamente finos utilizando maderas de primera, el fabrica mesas, sillas, ventanas, o cuelquier otro mueble diseñado.
El cliente solicito el crédito para compras de maderas como ser cedro, lapacho para la fabricación de carrocerías y  muebles estándar.
texts.en:
Mr. Martin G. is married, owns his own home with all the necessities in the zone of Edelira 60. His 3 children study at the school, Nacional de Edelira. He is the owner of a carpentry shop named Carpinteria G., which is long and well-established in the area and that allows him to have a very good clientele and a good income producing fine furniture, using primarily wood. He makes tables, chairs, windows or any furniture design. He is asking for a loan to buy wood such as cedar and walnut to manufacture auto-body specialty items and standard furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials and wood such as cedar, walnut, petereby

loans.name: D. Gilberte

texts.fr: Née le 03 Décembre 1971, D. D. Gilberte est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Gilberte ne vit plus avec son mari. Gilberte vit donc seule avec ses enfants à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Gilberte mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de différentes sauces) à Agla. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Gilberte achète ses produits. Gilberte  a 15 ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de cette activité, et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Gilberte ambitionne renforcer son activité et augmenter sa production journalière afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Gilberte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born December 3, 1971, D. Gilberte D. is the mother of three children, all having attended school, and of whom two are under her care. Gilberte no longer lives with her husband, and thus lives with her children in the Agla area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. To cope with her various expenses Gilberte sells food preparations (corn mush with different sauces) in Agla. She gets her ingredients from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Gilberte has 15 years’ experience in this activity, and has already been granted two loans by ALIDé, both repaid in full. Much in demand by customers, Gilberte wants to strengthen her activity and increase her daily production to meet the ever-increasing demand for her product. That is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of corn and sauce ingredients (tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es:
