Alodia sells engine parts from her business that she manages on the port. She has the support of her partner who works as a mechanic.

Alodia joined the Communal Bank “El Fruto Bendito” (The Blessed Fruit) two years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to sell food. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy parts and propellers for outboard motors. Her goal is to continue working by expanding her business through buying and selling motors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts & propellers for outboard motors

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga V. is a 68-year-old woman from the coastal town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines. At her older age and being single, it is not easy for her to face the difficulty of poverty but through the support of ASHI in her life, she never felt alone in achieving her dreams.


In 2001, Dominga joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc). ASHI means,” To rise up form poverty”. ASHI is an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in buying and selling fishnets and soon hopes to expand the business with more inventory.


Now on her 13th loan, she requested PHP 30,000 pesos as additional working capital for her business. Dominga is optimistic that her business will grow because she already has regular customers requesting orders from her (fish cage owner).


She dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her inventory of fishnet products. She also dreams of having a successful business that can provide a good life that is far away from poverty and support the needs of her brother and sisters.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying corn

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Marta Elizabeth E. posee un comercio de venta de Calzados que lleva el nombre de Calzados Ysapy
posee antigüedad en el ramo y cuenta con clientela formada
también posee local propio en el nuevo circuito comercial.

Vive en casa propia en el barrio San Pedro de la cuidad de Encarnación.

La cliente es soltera y tiene una hija de 9 años. 
El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercaderías de estación que son calzados escolares.
texts.en:
Sra. Marta Elizabeth E. manages a shoe store called “Calzados Ysapy”. She has experience in this sector and has accumulated an established clientele. Her store is located in the newer commercial district.

She owns a home in the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of Encarnación. Marta is single and has a nine year old daughter. Her loan will be used to purchase seasonal merchandise, such as school shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school shoes

loans.name: Mileinis María

texts.es:
Muy cerca al Estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla, en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, vive Mileinis María M. L. con su cónyuge y su 2 hijos de 2 y 8 años. Ella tiene 34 años y se dedica al comercio de ropa, cosméticos y variedades; este negocio lo inició en el año 2006 vendiendo mercancía, mediante guías especializadas productos empresariales. Es muy común que Mileinis con su alegría entusiasme a sus clientes a que den un vistazo a su revista y escojan el producto de su necesidad; ella vende al por mayor, al detal  y de contado, pero sobre pedidos y  cuando sus clientes solicitan los productos que no están en su guía, anota su necesidad y le responde con la mercancía requerida, porque precisamente su negocio consiste en dar respuesta oportuna y precisa a las necesidades de ropa, calzado, cosmético de su población objetivo; por eso precisamente necesita financiación por valor de $1.000.000 porque tiene encargos de ropa.
Desde que inició en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su mercado ha aumentado gradualmente, su utilidad se ha traducido en la mejora de sus ingresos y en su nivel de vida; con su esposo se han propuesto incrementar sus ingresos día a día y están dispuestos a hacer los esfuerzos necesarios para que su  hogar progrese. Su máximo desafío fue haber comprado desde el año pasado su casa, con ahorros, esfuerzo y muchos sacrificios, su propósito personal es promover su microempresa exitosamente
texts.en:
Mileinis María M. L. lives with her husband and two children (ages 8 and 2) in the neighborhood of Ciudadela 20 de Julio, near the Metropolitan Stadium in Barranquilla. She sells clothing, cosmetics, and variety of other merchandise. Mileinis started her business in 2006 by selling merchandise through specialty catalogs. It is very common to see her customers get excited when Milenis visits them so that they can thumb through the catalog and select the products they need. She sells wholesale, retail, and through cash transactions. When her customers request items that are not listed in the catalog, she writes down their orders and responds by delivering the exact items. Because her business is very precise and requires timely delivery to her target audience, Milenis needs a loan of 1,000,000 COP to purchase clothing to fulfill her outstanding orders.

Since she started working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, her customer base has increased. The assistance she has received has resulted in a higher income and better living standards. Her husband has proposed to increase their daily income and is willing to do whatever is necessary to keep their household progressing. Her biggest challenge last year was buying a home since it required a lot savings, effort, and sacrifice. She proposes to devote more time to promoting her micro-business so that it continues to run successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to fulfill her outstanding orders

loans.name: Francisca

texts.fr: M. Francisca est née vers 1962 et vit au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à TOGNI Martin, un électricien, Francisca est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  Francisca vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Francisca a arrêté les classes au cours primaire.  Il y a environs 15 ans que Francisca s’est mise à vendre de maïs et de haricot à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à son domicile.  Aussi elle vend de la tomate fraîche. C’est à Glazoué et Djoda que Francisca s’approvisionne.  Francisca a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé – ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle. Plus tard, Francisca ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
M. Francisca was born around 1962 and lives in the Agla district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to TOGNI Martin, an electrician, she is the mother of three children, who are all in school.  She lives together with her children and husband.  The couple jointly support the family.  Francisca dropped out of primary school.  About fifteen years ago, she started selling corn and beans at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and out of her home.  She also sells fresh tomatoes.  She gets her supplies in Glazoué and Djoda.  She has already obtained two loans from ALIDé -- these loans have been repaid.  Francisca is requesting another loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and for responding better to strong customer demand.  Her ambition is to buy a plot of land later on.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business and buying staple foods and fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Olga Amada

texts.es:
Olga Amada G. C. tiene 52 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 9 de sus hijos.  Tenía 12 hijos pero 11 están vivos porque uno falleció cuando unos ladrones le robaron y le mataron mientras venía a casa una noche de su trabajo en Quito.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas. La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Olga se dedica a los haceres domesticos.  Cocina, plancha, limpia, y cuida a los hijos en la casa. También ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo del campo.  Su esposo trabaja sembrando maiz, papas, habas, arvejas, trigo, y cebada.  Sacan los productos a las ferias en San Pablo y San Miguel.  Solicita el crédito para comprar los abonos para sembrar el maiz.

Su meta es ayudarles a sus hijos en las vidas y en los estudios para que salgan adelante.  En sus ratos libres, le gusta preparar la comida y ensaladas de las cosechas para los hijos.
texts.en:
Olga Amada G. C. is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband and nine children. She had 12 children but only 11 are alive because one died when thieves robbed and killed him while he was returning from his job in Quito one night. This member belongs to the rural communal bank "San Jose de las Orquideas" which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the community of San Jose de Palmas. Most people in the community are farmers whose principal crops are potatoes and corn. Olga does housework. She cooks, irons, cleans, and takes care of the children who are at home. She also helps her husband with his work in the fields. Her husband plants corn, potatoes, beans, peas, wheat, and barely. They take their products to the fairs in San Pablo y San Miguel. Olga is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers to plant corn. Her goal is to help her children get ahead in their lives and studies. In her free time, she likes to make food and salads (from their harvests) for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to plant corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up enough oil to make soap

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana sells clothing and shoes at the central market in Kherson. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her income is 3,000 UAH per month.

Tetyana is the kind of person who, if she decides something, she goes slowly but persistently until she reaches her goal. When she started this business, she really wanted to be economically independent. She has reached this goal now. Today she has many repeat clients and a stable business. Tetyana is a very friendly person and has good relationships with her neighbors at the market. 

Tetyana would like to borrow 8,600 UAH to increase seasonal inventories. Tetyana hopes to make additional profits and improve her living conditions. She lives in a house with her husband and son.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: H. Marie Claire est née en 1974 à Comè.  Marie Claire s’est installée à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, il y a 9 ans.  Mariée à ZOUNNON Charles, un revendeur, Marie Claire est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge.  Marie Claire vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie Claire a arrêté les classes au cours primaire et a appris la coiffure.  Marie Claire exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans et parallèlement elle vend des pagnes et des produits de beauté.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Marie Claire s’approvisionne.  Marie Claire a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et acheter des produits de beauté.  Marie Claire aime s’occuper à plein temps de ses activités.
texts.en:
H. Marie Claire was born in 1974 in Comè. Nine years ago Marie Claire settled in Agla in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Married to ZOUNNON Charles, a reseller, Marie Claire is the mother of four children, all in school, of which three are still in her care. Marie Claire lives with her children and husband. The couple jointly pays the family expenses. Marie Claire left school after primary (elementary) classes and learned hairdressing. Marie Claire has been in this business for fifteen years, and she also sells "pagnes" (traditional cloth) and beauty products. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Marie Claire has already received two loans through ALIDé, loans which she has repaid. She is seeking a third loan to build her business and buy beauty products. Marie Claire enjoys working full-time.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products, "pagnes," and hair extensions

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley M. P., tiene 28 años vive en el barrio San Nicolás, con su cónyuge y su hijo de cuatro años de edad. Desde hace 4 años, tiene un negocio de vender mercancías mediante el sistema de crédito a clientes que le pagan por cuotas de acuerdo a un plan de pago acordado. Su esposo también desarrolla la misma actividad, pero ella además de tener este negocio también es una auxiliar de enfermería que trabaja parte del tiempo en una clínica y donde tiene muchos clientes. En la actualidad aplica un crédito por valor de 1.500.000 para comprar mercancía sobre pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, como calzado vestidos bolsos, cosméticos,.
Este es el 3º crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ellos le han servido para aumentar su capital de trabajo; ella quiere progresar para que a su familia no le falte nada. Sueña con que algún día su hijo se convierta en un profesional especializado y por eso no ahorra esfuerzos en trabajar persistentemente.
Su mayor reto fue lograr pagar sus estudios  mediante un negocio y así como también los es, la responsabilidad de ser negociante, empleada, esposa y sobre todo madre al mismo tiempo.
Vive en un barrio tranquilo todo lo tiene cerca: centros comerciales, rutas de buses y eso le favorece porque puede trasladarse en corto tiempo de un lugar a otro y hacer sus compras en lugares comerciales cercanos a su sitio de vivienda.
texts.en:
Shirley M. P. is 28 years old and lives in the San Nicolas neighborhood with her husband and her 4 year old son. For four years, she has had a business selling merchandise through a credit system in which her customers pay her in installments according to a payment plan. Her husband also does the same work. Besides this business Shirley is also a nurse's assistant and works part-time in a clinic where she has many customers. She is applying for a credit of 1.500.000 in order to buy merchandise to order like shoes, dresses, bags and cosmetics for her customers. This is the third loan for her with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and they have helped her increase her capital. Shirley would like to progress so that her family never lacks anything. She dreams about her son one day being a professional and that is why she spends all her energy on working hard. Her greatest challenge was to be able to pay for her studies with her business. The responsibility of being a businesswoman, employee, wife and above all else a mother at the same time is also a challenge. Shirley lives in a quiet neighborhood that has everything nearby: shopping centers, bus routes, etc. This helps her because she can travel to various places in a short amount of time to buy things at shopping centers near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to order for her customers like shoes, dresses, bags and cosmetics

loans.name: Monica Asucena

texts.es:
Monica Asucena G. C. tiene 23 años, es soltera, y vive con su mama y abuelos maternos.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas. La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Monica estudia contabilidad y auditoria en la Universidad de Bolivar.  Ayuda en la agricultura los fines de semana y las mañanas antes de ir a la universidad.  Su familia siembra maiz, habas, y frejoles en menores cantidades.  Sacan los productos a las ferias en San Pablo y San Miguel.  Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en la agricultura para comprar abonos y urea.

Su meta para el futuro es acabar los estudios y conseguir trabajo en su profesion.  No tiene muchos tiempos libres, pero le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Monica Asucena G. C. is 23 years old, single and she lives with her mother and her maternal grandparents. She belongs to the solidarity group "San Jose of the Orchids" which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the community of San Jose de Palmas. Most of the people in the community are farmers and they grow corn and potatoes as their main crops. Monica studies accounting and auditing at the University of Bolivar. She helps with the farming on weekends and in the morning before going to school. Her family grows small crops of corn and various types of beans. They sell their products at the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel. She would like a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her agricultural work. Monica's goal for the future is to finish her studies and find a job in her profession. She doesn't have much free time but she likes to listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: A. Julienne est née en 1970 et vit au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 15 ans.  Mariée à ATCHE Alphonse, un maçon, elle a six enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Julienne n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Julienne vend de maïs, haricot, et riz à son domicile à Agla.  Aussi, elle vend du soja et de mil.  Julienne s’approvisionne à Bemberéké (au nord du Bénin) et a  déjà 10 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.  Julienne a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Julienne sollicite un autre crédit pour renforcer ses activités.  Plus tard, Julienne envisage acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
A. Julienne was born in 1970 and has lived in the Agla neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, for fifteen years. Married to ATCHE Alphonse, a mason, she has six children, all in school and in her care. Julienne lives together with her husband and children. The couple pays the family's expenses jointly. Julienne has never been to school. In order to meet her needs, she sells corn, beans, and rice from her home in Agla. She also sells soy beans and millet. Julienne gets her supplies in Bemberéké (in north Benin) and already has ten years' experience in this business. Julienne has already received a loan through ALIDé which she has fully repaid. She is seeking another loan to bolster her business. In the future, Julienne plans to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her business and purchase corn

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita L. is a resident of Ginoong Sanay, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 60 years old and married. She is seen as strong and determined to improve their status of living. She is a caring mother of two. Both of her children are of minor age and need her support.


Currently, Carmelita and her husband are busy with their fishing business just to earn the means of living every day. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center.


She applied for a new loan to PHP 30,000 to have additional working capital for her fishing business. Specifically, the loan fund will be used to pay for a motor boat (Bangka). Carmelita is a very good member of ASHI. She performs well in her business; when she has enough capital, she adds more business in order to gain more income. 


She hopes that through her loans from ASHI in partnership with KIVA, someday she will be able to save money for her future because the couple is getting older now. Along with her dream of a successful business, she hopes to see her children graduate from college and find a stable job.

loans.use: To pay for a motor boat.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del Banco Comunal de la ALDEA TIERRA COLORADA del municipio de Momostenango, del departamento de Totonicapán, están conformados por  MUJERES todas se conocen bien desde hace más de 10 años este grupo está conformado por once integrantes, las señoras que integran este grupos se dedican a varias actividades tales como;  venta de ropa, confección de mochilas, otras a la elaboración de canastas, venta de juguetes, manías, venta de canastas, venta de frutas y  otras dos se dedican a crianza de animales, todas ellas  decidieron formar un grupo para realizar contactos con vendedores mayoristas del lugar donde viven, el propósito es lograr obtener mejores ganancias sobre las ventas que realizan, al mismo  tiempo ayudar a sus familias ya que son de escasos recursos económicos, acudieron a la Asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo para incrementar el capital de negocio con la que cuenta cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank ALDEA TIERRA COLORADA in the municipality of Momostenango, in the department of Totonicapán are all women who have known each other for more than 10 years. There are 11 members in the group and they work in a variety of activities, including: selling clothes, making backpacks, basket-weaving, selling toys, selling baskets, selling fruits, and raising animals to sell. All of them decided to form this group to make contact with wholesalers in the area where they live. The goal is to increase their earnings on the sales they make and to help their families because they have such limited economic resources. They approached the ASDIR association for a loan in order to increase the business capital that each one of them relies on.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Alma Godety

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Alma F. tiene su propia pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles, golosinas, galletas, entre otros productos.
Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dichos productos para la pulpería porque le urge a lo inmediato adquirirlos para así continuar ofreciéndolos a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Señora Alma F. owns her own corner store in the municipality of Nagarote. She sells all kinds of products such as food, candy, cookies etc. She would like a loan to buy more of these products for her store as soon as possible so she can continue providing them to her customers who visit the store daily.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products for her convenience store

loans.name: Ariana María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en León, la señora Ariana M. se dedica a trabajar en un centro de labores y ha iniciado a incrementar sus esfuerzos para mejorar las condiciones de su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus tres hijos.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que esta requiere a lo inmediato de inversión. Es por esta razón que con dicho crédito comprará 20 láminas de zinc y otros materiales de construcción y también pagará la mano de obra que le realizará el trabajo. Ella espera ser beneficiada con el crédito y así mejorar sus condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Nagarote within the Department of León, Sra. Ariana M. is employed at a work center. She has started to invest more effort into improving the conditions for her three children.

Ariana is requesting a loan to make immediate improvements to her house. The money will be used to purchase 20 sheets of zinc (corrugated roofing material) and other construction materials. She will also pay for the labor needed to complete the job. She expects the loan to be of benefit and help improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to make improvements

loans.name: Denis Isaac

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, el señor Denis T. se dedica a la actividad pecuaria por medio de la crianza de ganado que ha sabido desarrollar y adquirir gran experiencia en esta actividad.
 
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de dos terneros de desarrollo con el propósito de proceder a su crianza y sacarles el máximo provecho para así obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Nagarote, Sr. Denis T. raises livestock. He has acquired extensive experience in this activity. At the moment, he is requesting a loan to buy two calves that he will raise so that he can generate income to improve the standard of living for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Aragón es un caballero que se dedica a la actividad de agricultura ya que atiende una área de arboles forestales, supervisa y cosechas de las siembras que realizan en la finca, orienta a los trabajadores de la finca en sus actividades, sus labores inician a las 6:00 de la mañana y finalizan a las 06:00 de la tarde, o dependiendo de la labor del día incluye si es necesario los días sábados y domingos. 

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la cosecha de una siembra que realizó en su parcela y por esta razón es que anhela que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para dar lugar a la cosecha y así generar utilidades para el mantenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Aragón is a gentleman who engages in a number of agricultural activities. He manages a forest of trees, monitors the planting of crops on his farm, and supervises his farm workers in their various duties. His schedule begins at 6am and ends at 6pm or whenever work has been completed for the day. If needed, he also works on Saturdays and Sundays.

Juan is requesting a loan to invest in his crops that are ready to be harvested. Therefore, he is anxious for his loan to be approved so that he can proceed with his harvest and generate the income needed to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire the inputs needed to harvest his crops

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima S. sells smoked fish (salmon) at Abura.  Fatima has received a junior high education.  She is single and has four children. Fatima has been selling smoked fish for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and the general up keep of the house. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process (smoking the fish) for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business and supply other people.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima F. is married and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband Pedro, a tricycle driver. She has one child who is currently working as a teacher. Maxima is a hard working entrepreneur with two businesses in food vending and hog raising. She has been in business working as an entrepreneur for almost seven years. 

Maxima would like to receive a loan to purchase additional inventory for her food selling business and supplies for her hog raising venture. She is planning to purchase a variety of products such as sugar, starch, rice, coconuts, and feed for the hogs. Maxima believes that having a greater variety of inventory will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood.  A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1997, Maxima has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long term goals are to purchase a new jeepney and tricycle so she can expand her food vending business to other surrounding neighborhoods. By owning her own transportation, Maxima will save time and money in purchasing a greater variety of inventory as well as selling products in additional territories.  With her hard work, focus, and determination, Maxima is hopeful that her business ventures will continue to grow and improve the overall standard of living for her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her food selling business and supplies for her hog raising venture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Candido

texts.en: Candido is 44 years old and is married to Nancy Ferreira.  They have three young children together.  Candido runs a food stall that sells rice, noodles, yerba mate, oil and milk among other products.  Previously, Candido worked as a mechanic and saved his money so that he could open this food ll.  With the help of his is wife who works at the food stall, and thanks to the low prices he is able to offer his customers, Candido's business has been a success.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, yerba mate, oil, and gasoline among other products.  Candido's dream is to expand his business to offer his customers even more products.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, yerba mate, oil

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro viviendas surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser :  venta de mercaderías comestibles, despensa,  venta de lencerías, olería, modista, despensa , venta de comidas   etc. 
Cada señora realiza una actividad independiente para aumentar sus ingresos con el fin de ayudar a su familia.
La señora Analía trabaja con mucho esfuerzo en la venta de ropas esta actividad lo realiza de manera ambulante visitando a clientes para ofrecer sus productos, en ocasiones lo acompañan sus hijos para cargar con las mercaderías ya que resultan muy pesadas para ella sola.
Actualmente piensa surtir sus mercaderías con uniformes de colegios ya que la temporada escolar ya esta en curso.
Por ello quiere aprovechar la ocasión para sacar ventajas vendiendo sus mercaderías, así las demás integrantes también están organizando actividades similares ofrecer para la venta.
texts.en:
This group from the “Barrio San Pedro” apartments was formed following an information campaign in the neighborhood. All of the women are involved in productive activities, such as: food sales, pantry, linen goods, pottery, dressmaking, etc. The ladies run their own businesses in order to supplement their incomes and help their families. Analía puts a lot of effort into her clothing sales business. She sells on foot, visiting customers to offer them her merchandise. Sometimes her children go with her and help her carry her bundles, which are too heavy for her to carry alone. She plans to supplement her merchandise with school uniforms, now that the school year has begun. She wants to take advantage of this time in order to sell her merchandise. The other women in the group are also planning similar activities to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio C. is 41 years old and married to Pablina Alvarenga.  The couple has four kids. His two daughters are 20 and 14 and his two sons are 18 and 13.  Before opening his business, Julio had to go to work in Argentina in a leather factory and send money back to his family each month.  With his savings, he was able to open his food stall.  Thanks to his business' great location, he has been able to form a significant client base and sell his products in large quantities. The loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator.  Julio's dream is to purchase his own land as he currently rents his home.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou D. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 3 ans et a de belles performances en terme d'épargne. Elle fait la vente de tissus bordés et de l'élevage de volailles. Son objectif est de créer de l'emploi à sa sœur qui l'aide dans ses diverses activités commerciales et de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumou D. is a 59-year-old woman, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Wango for three years and has had good results in terms of savings. She sells embroidered cloth and raises fowl. Her goal is to create employment for her sister, who helps with her various commercial activities, and to participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster and publicize her business activity

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA AMELIA R. D. C. tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito D. TRUJILLO, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESUS EN TI CONFIO; La socia  presenta estudios superiores D. la carrera profesional D. TRABAJO SOCIAL, pero debido a falta D. recursos económicos no se tituló y por ese motivo no ejerció su carrera. 
Tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 2 dependen económicamente D. ella. MARIA se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos como: colonias, desodorantes, labiales, bloqueador solar, shampoo, etc. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra D. cosméticos como: labiales, rubores, colonias, perfumes, etc. para aumentar su stock y así estar preparada ante cualquier pedido D. sus clientes.
Con este crédito D. 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará mas cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, gel, shampoo, rubores, delineadores, etc. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y ganancias para así poder continuar apoyando en la crianza y educación D. sus hijos. 

Maria esta afiliada al seguro D. vida que le ofrece Manuela Ramos, ella opina que el seguro es muy importante y necesario, puesto que nadie esta libre D. algun accidente en el trabajo o en las calles.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department in Peru and belongs to the “Jesus en ti Confio” (I believe in you Jesus) communal bank. She is educated as a social worker, but due to lack of financial resources, she did not receive her degree and therefore did not begin this career. She has four children, of whom two depend on her financially. Maria sells cosmetics, such as: colognes, deodorants, lip products, sun block, shampoo, etc. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to increase her inventory in order to be prepared to meet any of her customers’ requests. She will use the money from this loan of 1,300 PEN ($$$$) to buy more cosmetics. She hopes to be able to increase her sales and income in order to continue raising her children and providing for their education. Maria is affiliated with the life insurance that Manuela Ramos offers. She believes that insurance is very important and necessary, because no one is completely immune from accidents on the job or in the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia C. is from Barangay Buhangin, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 65 years old, married, and has seven children. The eldest is 47 years old and the youngest is a 27 years old. The couple is working hard to raise their big family. 

Lucia owns and operates a general store and sells charcoal in the local community. The couple also is engaged in “kaing” making business (small baskets). She has been engaged in her businesses for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a week.

In 1997, she joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI.

Lucia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Having this loan will provide a chance to reach her dreams in life: to have a winning business, a good life, and financial means of supporting her family and funding the college education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: The loan fund will be use to invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: D. Félicité est née en 1972 et vit au quartier Sodjatimey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis neuf ans.  Mariée à GBEDO Pascal, un soudeur, Félicité est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Félicité vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Félicité vend des gâteaux (fait à base de maïs, sucre, et lait) au ciné concorde à Cotonou, et parallèlememt, elle vend du « akpan » (bouillie faite à base de maïs).  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Félicité s’approvisionne.  Félicité exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Félicité a déjà bénéficié de quelques crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un autre crédit pour acheter le maïs, le sucre, et du lait en boîte.
texts.en:
Félicité D. was born in 1972 and has lived in the Sodjatimey district of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin for the past nine years. She has four children, all of whom attend school and live at home. Félicité lives with her children and her husband. She is married to Pascal GBEDO, a welder. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. To meet their needs, Félicité sells biscuits (made from corn, sugar and milk) at the Concorde movie theater in Cotonou and also sells “akpan” (corn-based porridge). She started this business five years ago. Félicité gets her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. Félicité has previously taken out a few loans from ALIDé and has repaid them all. She is requesting this new loan to buy corn, sugar and canned milk.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, sugar and canned milk

loans.name: Maribel Yobana

texts.es:
Yobana vive en San Juan de Lurigancho tiene 41 años y es madre de 2 pequeños hijos que aún dependen de ella, tras el abandono de su esposo, ha sabido ser una madre soltera con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siendo responsable, dinámica y activa.
Todo comenzó hace más de 6 años atrás, cuando Yobana sentía la necesidad de tener un negocio propio e independiente de su entonces esposo, así fue como conoció a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, entonces gracias a un préstamo que solicitó, ella pudo abrir su primer negocio, en la venta de balones de gas para cocina, donde ella misma los trasportaba y repartía, cabe mencionar que es un trabajo que no cualquier mujer lo puede hacer.
Luego Yobana solicitó otros préstamos a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, con los que poco a poco pudo abrir otro de sus negocios, el de tener una bodega en su propia casa, en la cual vende abarrotes con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Otro de sus negocios, al cual ella llama hobby, es el de enseñar a jugar voleibol y entrenar a niñas en este juego deportivo. Es el deporte que le causa pasión, y casi nunca se pierde de jugarlo los fines de semana.
También ella tiene el negocio de vender productos de belleza Esika, el cual lo promociona en sus otros negocios, a sus clientes en la venta de gas para cocina, a sus vecinos que compran en su bodega, y a sus amigas deportistas con las que juega voleibol.
Yobana ha conseguido mucho en base a su esfuerzo, como darle estudios a sus hijos, tener su propia bodega en casa, darle a sus hijos lo que pudo darle de todo corazón, y aún tiene mucho por hacer, uno se sus sueños es de tener un gran bazar en lo que pueda vender todo lo que tenga en mente, y no descansara porque pondrá todo su empeño y capacidad para conseguir lo que más desea.
texts.en:
Yobana lives in San Juan de Lurigancho. She is 41 years old and the mother of two small children who have depended on her since her husband abandoned her. She has learned to be a single mother with a desire to come out ahead by being responsible, dynamic, and active. It all began six years ago, when Yobana felt the need to start her own business, independent from that of her, then, husband. This is when she learned of EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD. Thanks to the loan she received, she was able to start her own business selling cylinders of gas for cooking, which she transported and delivered. This is not a job that can be done by just ANY woman. Yobana then requested additional loans through EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, which allowed her to open another one of her businesses. Little by little she opened a small grocery shop in her home, which she runs with the help of her children. Another one of her business, which she calls a hobby, is teaching girls to play volleyball. She is very passionate about this sport and rarely misses the opportunity to play on the weekends. She also sells Esika beauty products, which she promotes within her other businesses; to her gas customers, to her neighbors from her grocery shop, and to her fellow volleyball players. Yobana has gotten a lot from her efforts, like being able to pay for her children’s education, having her own shop in her home, and being able to give her children all that she could give them with all her heart. One of her dreams is to have a large store where she can sell anything she thinks of. She will not fail because she will give her all to get what she desires.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide working capital

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
La señora MARIA MAXIMINA tiene 76 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DECIDIDAS. La socia es analfabeta y tiene 7 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y panca de choclos en la puerta de su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles empezó a vender gaseosas y cervezas.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará alfalfa y pancas de choclo al por mayor, los mismoas que venderá a sus vecinos y también a los establos.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y asi mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 76 year old and lives in the Del Provenir district in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the “Mujeres Decididas” (Women of Decision) communal bank. She is illiterate and has seven adult children. She sells alfalfa and corn stalks from her home. Her first loan of 300 PEN allowed her to begin selling soft drinks and beer. She will use the money from this loan of 800 PEN ($300) primarily to buy alfalfa and corn stalks to sell to her neighbors and to the stables. She hopes to increase her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alfalfa and corn stalks

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: F. Célestine est née en 1965 à Agonlin.  Célestine vit au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 30 ans.  Mariée à AGOSSOU Bertin, un menuisier, elle est mère de sept enfants, dont six sont à sa charge.  Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés.  Célestine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Célestine vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc, et des divers (pâtes alimentaires, savons de lessive, haricots, papiers hygiénique) au marché d’Agla.  Célestine exerce cette activité depuis 30 ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Pahou et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Célestine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Célestine F. was born in 1965 in Agonlin. She has lived in the Agla district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin for the past 30 years. She has seven children, six of whom are at home; not all the children attend school. Célestine lives with her children and her husband. She is married to Bertin Agossou, a carpenter. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. Célestine sells corn, cassava flour and diverse products (pasta, laundry soap, beans, tissue paper) at the Agla market. She started this business 30 years ago. She gets her supplies in Pahou and at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. Célestine has repaid the two previous loans from ALIDé and is requesting a third loan to strengthen her business activities.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is 49 years old and married to Emiliana Ruiz.  They have six children together.  Miguel works in construction, building and repairing houses.  Previously, Miguel was an assistant bricklayer to his father. After he learned the trade, he began working on his own. Now Miguel has 18 years of experience in construction.  Thanks to this experience, he is considered one of the best in his area and his business has prospered.  The loan will be used to replace some tools that are in disrepair, such as an electric drill, paint bush, etc.  Miguel's dream is to acquire more cattle, as his wife produces milk and cheese.

loans.use: To purchase tools such as an electric drill, paint brush, etc

loans.name: Basilia

texts.fr: G. Basilia est née vers 1969 et vit au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 25 ans.  Mariée à HOUETON Léon, Basilia est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Basilia a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Basilia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Basilia vend des vivres par le système de distribution. Il y a 20 ans que Basilia exerce cette activité.  Basilia a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Elle sollicite un autre crédit pour élever le niveau de son activité et acheter des vivres.  Dans l’avenir, Basilia envisage acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Basilia G. was born around 1969 and for the past 25 years has lived in the Agla district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Basilia is the mother of three children who are enrolled in school and takes care of an additional child. Basilia lives with her children and her husband, Léon Houeton. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. To meet their needs, Basilia sells food supplies via the local distribution network. She started this business 20 years ago. Basilia has repaid her previous ALIDé loan. She is requesting a new loan to prop up her business activities and increase her food supply inventory. In the future, Basilia hopes to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food supplies

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El  señor Julio S. labora en un centro de capacitación profesional en Managua donde a diario busca la manera de cómo salir adelante en su labor para continuar llevando el sustento a su habitación donde tiene dos hijos a su cargo y en edad escolar.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro y mano de obra para la construcción de un muro en la parte del patio de su casa de habitación para  darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia que tanto depende de él.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio S. works at a vocational training center in Managua. Everyday he goes to work he works hard to be able to provide for his home and family. Julio is a father of school age children. The loan he has requested will be used to invest in the purchase of construction materials like cement, sand, tools and labor to build a wall around his patio. This will improve the quality of life of Julio's family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to build a security wall

loans.name: Juanita Yoana

texts.es:
La señora JUANITA YOANA C. B. tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DECIDIDAS. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Juanita se dedica a la venta de manjar blanco, rosquitas, queso, quesillo, etc. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles empezó a vender sus rosquitas que compro al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará rosquitas, quesos, manajar blanco, quesillo para cubrir los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Ella sueña con aumentar su negocio y empezar a vender todos los días en el mercado que esta cerca  a su casa.
texts.en:
Juanita is 25 years old and lives in the “Del Provenir” district of the “Trujillo” province in the “La Libertad” department in Peru. She is a member of the “MUJERES DECIDIDAS” (Women of Decision) communal bank and has completed the 5th grade. She has two children who depend on her financially. Juanita sells delicacies, bagels, breads, cheeses, etc. After receiving her first loan of 300 PEN, she began selling the bagels that she bought in bulk. She will use the 800 PEN ($300) from this loan to buy items to cover her customers’ requests. She hopes to grow her business and begin selling daily in the marketplace near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread and cheeses for resale

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Hilario M. es una persona muy trabajadora es empleado de una fabrica en el aria de producción, también se dedica a la construcción los fines de semana.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar herramienta que necesita para realizar sus trabajos de construcción. 
Ya que son los ingresos que tiene para el y su esposa quienes viven solos, porque sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de sus trabajos de construcción.
texts.en:
Hilario is a very hard worker. He works in a factory in an industrial area and also works construction on the weekends. He is asking for this loan in order to buy some tools that he needs for his construction work. The income he earns is for him and his wife, because his children have their own families. He will repay this loan from the income her receives from his construction work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Felix Nicolas

texts.es:
El Sr. Félix Nicolás Meléndez tiene un taller de Carpintería y Ebanistería en su casa de habitación. El hace lo que son roperos, mesas, comedores, sillas, puertas, etc. 

El va a utilizar este crédito para comprar madera ya que tiene  2 juegos de sillas abuelitas encargadas que hacer y un comedor, pero debido a que tiene trabajos pendientes que no le han pagado no pudo comprar  la madera.

El piensa que con estos trabajos que le encargaron podrá surtir más en madera su negocio y así ir creciendo poco a poco, aunque dice manifestar que gracias a los créditos que le ha otorgado  CEPRODEL,  ha podido salir adelante con su taller y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix Nicolás Meléndez has a carpentry and cabinet-making workshop in his home. He produces armoires, tables, dining sets, chairs, doors, and other items.

He will use this loan to buy wood. He has two sets of rocking chairs and a dining set that he has to complete. However, he has not been paid for his outstanding orders, so he does not have the money to buy wood.

Once these jobs are completed, Félix says he will be able to restock his business with more wood and continue to grow over time. He expresses his thanks to CEPRODEL for providing the loans that have helped him succeed in his business and in his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Las Luchadoras De Momos Group

texts.es: Este grupo de señoras cuentan con 15 integrantes el cual viven a una distancia de 25 kilómetros de la ciudad, donde ellas venden y compran sus productos, toda ellas residen en el Caserío San José Siguila, del municipio de Momostenango, ellas se dedican a la elaboración y venta de copal, la cual es un producto que se utiliza para la celebración maya además de ello es muy rentable porque la materia prima que utilizan se produce en el lugar donde viven, solamente que ellas se encargan de transformarlo en productos de venta, así también varias de ellas se dedican a la crianza de ganado bovino, en su mayoría son de escasos recursos económicos, la cual se han agrupado para poder tener financiamiento de la Asociación ASDIR, ya que es la única manera que ellas logran alcanzar sus objetivos, y de esa manera podrán ayudar a la familia de cada una de ellas, con el crédito que recibirán aumentarán su capital de trabajo, y de esa manera podrán obtener mejores ingresos económicos para el mejoramiento de vida de cada una de sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 15 members who live 25 kilometers from the city where they buy and sell their products. They all live in “Caserío San José Siguila” within the city of Momostenango, where they make and sell “copal,” which is used during the Mayan celebrations. It’s very profitable because the primary ingredients they use are produced in the area where they live. They just turn them into sellable products. Each of them also raises cattle. For the most part they all have limited financial resources, so they have banded together in order to be able to obtain financing through “la Asociación ASDIR,” since this is the only way that they will be able to accomplish their objectives and be able to help each of their families. This loan will allow them to increase their working capital and incomes and help improve their families’ lives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy primary ingredients

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Antonio Pavón López, labora como Técnico de Computación en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos y estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, es el segundo crédito que a Trabajado con CEPRODEL, estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: pintura y brocha para pintar su casa de habitación, para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia. 

Noel dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel a podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sr. Noel Antonio Pavón López works as a computer technician at the National University of Engineering. He is married and has two dependent children who are in school. This will be the second loan he has received from CEPRODEL. His previous loan was used to improve his living conditions.

The loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy the materials needed to paint his house. This will provide better living conditions for his family. Noel expresses his thanks to CEPRODEL for providing the loans that enable him to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint & paintbrushes

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Née en 1964, A. Jeanne est mariée à AWISSOU Francis, un peintre auto. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. La famille s'est installée au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 8 ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne  n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Jeanne vend des perles de façon ambulante depuis 22 ans. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Jeanne s'approvisionne. Jeanne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Jeanne envisage agrandir son activité et se faire plus de revenu pour mieux assurer les charges de sa famille. Mais Jeanne ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver, raison pour laquelle Jeanne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne A. was born in 1964 and is married to Francis Awissou, an automobile painter. They work together to meet the needs of the family. The couple has five children who have attended school, two of which are at home. Jeanne did not attend school. About eight years ago, the family moved to the Fidjrossè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. To meet their needs, Jeanne has sold pearls by walking her product from door to door for the past 22 years. She gets her supplies at the Dantokpa international market of Benin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé and has repaid her loans. Jeanne hopes to expand her business and increase her revenues to better meet the needs of the family. But she does not have sufficient financial resources to do this, which leads Jeanne to requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pearls

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, es una mujer alegre, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre de un menor de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos regionales, esta actividad la realiza en el puerto de Pucallpa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, que se desempeña como cocinero en una Empresa.  Maribel forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dalinas II”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de productos de la región.
Con este crédito de 2500 soles, comprará más productos regionales y madera para aserrar. La meta de Maribel es poner un negocio en su casa y ser una distribuidora de granos y plátanos de la región.
texts.en:
Maribel is a cheerful woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 28 years old and the mother of a young son. She buys and sells regional products in the Port of Pucallpa. She has the full support of her husband, who works as a cook for a company. Maribel has been a member of the “Las Dalinas II” communal bank for the past five years. She used her first 300 PEN loan to invest in regional products. She will use the money from this loan of 2,500 PEN ($900) to buy more regional products and lumber. Her goal is to run the business from her home and become a distributor of grains and bananas from the region.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Regional products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta tiene un hijo a su cargo  y este se  encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, es el cuarto crédito que a Trabajado con CEPRODEL, y estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro y mano de obra para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás del patio de su casa de habitación para  darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia. 

Ella dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel a podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
This client is a single mother who has one dependent child attending school. This will be the fourth loan she has received from CEPRODEL. All of her previous loans were used to improve her living conditions. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and iron, and pay for labor to build a security wall in her backyard. This will provide better living conditions for her family. She expresses her thanks to CEPRODEL for providing loans that allow her to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for materials & labor to build a security wall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James A. is married and has two children. He has received a senior high education. James sells engine oil and car spare parts at Abura. James uses his income to pay for school fees and utility bills.  James will use the loan to purchase more oil engine and spare parts for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to save to reinvest into the business to enable him increase his stock of goods.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil and other spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Née le 25 Avril 1961 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin, V. Odile réside depuis 20 ans environs à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AKOUEHOU Clément, un chauffeur, Odile est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Odile vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Odile a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Il y a environs 22 ans que Odile vend des tissus et secondairement, des glacières par le système de distribution. Odile fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Odile a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Odile sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Odile V. was born on April 25, 1961 in Abomey, the historic capital of Benin. For the past 20 years, she has lived in the vicinity of Agla, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Clément Akouehou, a driver, and has three children who attend school. Odile lives alone with her children and is solely responsible for them. Odile stopped attending classes before high school. For about 22 years, Odile has sold fabrics and also ice boxes using the local distribution network. Odile gets her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. She has repaid her two previous loans from ALIDé. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to strengthen her business activities and better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and cloth

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha P. S., es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de cristalería, productos derivados del plástico y productos de melanina. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en Mercado Israel lewite entrada principal de la farmacia los ángeles 20vras abajo, quien junto con su hija atienden el negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de ropa y productos derivados del plástico, cristalería y ropa interior, que se vende mucho.

Es madre soltera, con dos hijos a su cargo, ninguna esta  en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.


Lleva 25créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha P. S. is an enterprising woman who owns a business selling glassware and products made of plastic or melamine resin. She started with initial capital of 10,000 NIO and also acquired a loan ten years ago. Her business is located in the Israel Lewite Market, twenty yards from the main entrance of Los Ángeles Pharmacy. Martha and her daughter manage the business from 8am until 5pm. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy clothing, plastic products, glassware, and undergarments. She sells a lot of these products.

Martha is a single mother of two dependent children, but they are not of school age. Prior to owning a business, she worked as a housekeeper.

Martha has received 25 loans from CEPRODEL over the past five years. The proceeds were invested into her business, which has grown by diversifying her products so that she could complete in the marketplace. She is thankful for the financing provided by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, plastic products, glassware, and undergarments

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Mercedes del Socorro B. Q., ella tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, lleva 7  créditos con CEPRODEL, estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 Ella trabaja en un salón de belleza ubicado en Altagracia colegio divino Pastor.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, zinc, cemento etc. para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación en la  vivienda en la que habita, esto es para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes del Socorro B. Q. is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. She has taken out seven loans with CEPRODEL that have been used to make improvements to her home. Mercedes works at a beauty salon located in Altagracia near the Divine Shepherd High School.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase construction materials such as iron, zinc, cement, and other items. She will add another bedroom to her house that will provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to add a bedroom

loans.name: Carisma Group

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia Gloria C. Sánchez tiene 56 años de edad y vive en  Valle de Chalco Solidaridad  en el Estado de México desde hace 30 años. En este lugar tuvo a sus siete hijos. Hace 20 años enviudo y esto le afecto mucho tanto económicamente como moral ya que se quedo a cargo de sus hijos las cuales saco adelantes.  Seis de ellos ya se casarón. En este momento le queda un  hijo soltero y en edad escolar, siendo esa su preocupación de seguirlo apoyando. Ella quiere obtener ingresos en la venta de ropa de segundo uso.  Ella requiere de capital para  comprar la ropa por paca y esto le ayudara a tener mayores ganancias y solventar los gastos básicos de ella y su hijo quien también le ayuda en su negocio cuando tiene tiempo, por esta razón se une con algunos vecinos con mismas inquietudes para formar un grupo y solicitar un crédito a través de fundación Realidad. Ella agradece de ante mano el apoyo recibido para cumplir sus expectativas de vida y seguir luchando.
Las Personas con las que se une son:

Benita O. S. venta de joyería.
Víctor R. R.  venta de camisas.
Carmela G. Abundis venta de ropa.
Elizabeth R. E. Venta de accesorios para zapatos.
Juan Mejia G. Venta de básculas.
Karen T. Martínez venta de tenis.
Liliana R. E. venta de zapatos.
Anastacia G C. Sánchez venta de ropa usada(en la foto aparece con un pantalón blanco y sueter azul).
Carmen Z. H.  venta de dulces.
Eladio Martínez A. tiene una carpintería.
Cristóbal H. venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 56 years old and has lived in Valle de Chalco Solidaridad in the State of México for the past 30 years and her seven children were born there. She became a widow seven years ago, which affected her financially and emotionally, as she had to continue to care for her children, whom she has helped to get ahead. Six of them are now married. She has one school-aged son whom she must continue to support. She would like to earn some income selling second hand clothing and needs working capital in order to buy bundles of clothing. This will help her increase her income and allow her to pay for her and her son’s basic needs. He also helps her in her business when he is able. She has partnered with some of her neighbors, with similar concerns, to form a group and request a loan through “Fundación Realidad.” She is grateful for the support she has received during her struggle to meet her life’s expectations. Her partners are: Benita – Jewelry sales Víctor – Shirt sales Carmela – Clothing sales Elizabeth – Shoe accessory sales Juan – Scale sales Karen – Sneaker sales Liliana – Shoe sales Anastacia – Second hand clothing sales (shown wearing while pants and a blue sweater) Carmen – Candy sales Eladio – Has a carperntry shop Cristóbal – Second-hand clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchace clothing and accessories for resale

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Arroyo Porá viviendas surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación . Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de ropas, kiosko, venta de cosméticos, venta de panificados, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de artículos escolares y fotocopias ,venta de golosinas    etc. 
Cada una realiza una actividad independiente así como la señora Vilma quien se dedica a la venta de ropa en un salón que ella instaló después de formar parte del comité de mujeres Kuña Guapa.
Ella abre su negocio desde muy temprano y ofrece sus mercaderías a muy buen precio para todos sus vecinos, el negocio es atendido con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Comenta la señora Vilma que el ingreso del negocio ayuda mucho para os gastos que sustentaba solo su marido por ello, agradece bastante al comité ya que mediante ella se animo a abrir su negocio propio.
texts.en:
This group from the “Barrio Arroyo Porá” apartments grew as a result of making contact with one of the foundation’s constituents. All of the women are involved in productive activities, such as: clothing sales, kiosk (snack) sales, cosmetic sales, sales of baked goods, fruit and vegetable sales, sales of school supplies and photocopy services, sweet treat sales, etc. Each lady runs her own business. Vilma sells clothing in a boutique that she created after becoming part of the Committee for the Women of Kuña Guapa. She opens her business very early and offers good quality merchandise to all of her neighbors. She attends to her business with the help of her children. Vilma tells us that the income from her business helps meet the household expenses that they used to rely solely on her husband’s income for. She appreciates the committee very much. It is because of it that she was inspired to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Mercedes Gerarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes C. M. trabaja como asalariada en una escuela que queda en la comunidad de palacio municipio del Viejo.

Ella va a utilizar este crédito en la Reparación de la cocina de su casa, ya que es una persona de escasos recursos.
Ella tiene 30 años de trabajar como profesora en esa escuela, gracias a su trabajo ha podido darle la educación necesaria a su hija ya que siempre ha sido madre soltera.
Ella nos manifiesta  que gracias a la ayuda que CEPRODEL,  le ha brindado durante estos 5 créditos que ha tenido, ha venido levantando su casa poco a poco, con la ayuda de Dios y CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Mercedes C. M. is a salaried employee of a school that is in the Palacio community in the Viejo municipality. She is going to use the loan to repair the kitchen in her house. She is a person with scant resources. She has worked as a teacher in this school for 30 years. Thanks to her work she has been able to give her daughter the necessary education. Mercedes has always been a single mother. She tells us that thanks to the help from Ceprodel she has had five loans. She has been raising her house little by little with help from God and Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. is married and has four children. She has received a senior high education.  Mary sells foodstuffs such as plantain, okro, onions, pepper, tomatoes, salted fish and others at Abura. She has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a mason.  Mary uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and other household responsibilities.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Aurelia R. es cliente antigua de nuestra empresa está casado con 
el Sr. Francisco Arriola son padres de cinco hijos, están domiciliados en el 
km 9 lado Acaray de Ciudad del Este.

La Señora se dedica a la compra de ropas y calzados para su posterior venta en la
 Ciudad de Saltos del Guaira, y el Sr Francisco se dedica a  venta de gallinas
 en la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, poseen un vehículo en la cual hacen la 
distribución, se trata de personas muy trabajadora, lo reflejan con cada crédito 
cancelado con la Fundación Paraguaya, el crédito es para la compra de 
mercaderías, como uniformes de todo tipo ya que están comenzando las clase y
 quieren aprovechar la ocasión para la venta de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a former client of ours. She is married to Francisco and they are the parents of five children. They live on the “9 kilometer” side of Acaray in the City of Este. She buys and sells shoes and clothing in the City of Saltos del Guaira and Francisco sells chickens in the City of Coronel Oviedo. They have a vehicle which they use to make deliveries. They are hard working people, as evidenced by all of the previous repaid loans through Fundación Paraguaya. They will use the money from this loan to buy additional merchandise for resale, such as school uniforms of all types. They would like to take advantage of the fact that the school year has begun, in order to sell their merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de uniformes escolares como polleras, camisas blancas y celestes, medias,pantalones.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Rekavo Group

texts.en: The Women Entrepreneurs' Committee of Villa Hayes Chaco is in it's first cycle and the loans are from 100,000 gs to 300,000 gs.  Most of the clients sell soft drinks; others sell perfume or linen goods, or raise animals.  Thanks to the loan obtained through Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya, these women are able to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Purchase meat, animals, linen

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Angel de 32 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Andrea Marin con quien procreó 2 hijos menores, habita junto a su familia en la Comarca Carquita del municipio de La Libertad, Chontales, es un pequeño productor que se dedica a la siembra de granos basicos, ademas al cuido de sus 3 vaquitas, de quienes obtiene leche para el consumo de la casa.  Miguel esta solicitando su primer credito con el objetivo de establecer cultivo de maiz y frijol, el que comercializara y le permitira obtener mayores ingresos que le ayudarian a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa  quien le ayudan a la siembra y cuido de la tierra, ademas con la experiencia necesaria para este trabajo, pues desde muy pequeño ha trabajado la tierra.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old and is married to Andrea. They have two children and live with his family in “Comarca Carquita del municipio de La Libertad, Chontales.” He is a small farmer and raises basic grains. He also tends his three cows, from which he gets milk. Manuel is asking for this loan in order to establish a crop of corn and beans, which he will sell. This will allow him to increase his income, and improve his family’s living conditions. He has the full support of his wife, who helps him with the planting and tending of the land. He has been farming since he was a boy.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising beans and corn

loans.name: Kava Raity Group

texts.es: The Women Entrepreneurs Committee of Benjamin Aceval Chaco is in its first loan cycle.  Many of the clients sell clothing, whereas others sell food, perfumes, linen goods, and baked goods.  Thanks to the loan obtained trough Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva these women are able to get ahead in life.
texts.en:
The Women Entrepreneurs Committee of Benjamin Aceval Chaco is in its first loan cycle. Many of the clients sell clothing, whereas others sell food, perfumes, linen goods, and baked goods. Thanks to the loan obtained trough Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva these women are able to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make baked goods, purchase fruit, vegetables, and linen goods

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La sra. Angela vive en la zona de Pueblo Nuevo en el Plan 3000, ella tiene 5 hijos que asisten a primaria y secundaria, ella sola mantiene el hogar ya que es Madre soltera y tiene que trabajar duro para sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de bolsos, hamacas, cinturones, carteras, collares y aros que vende a las tiendas de artesanias, ademas de que tiene muchos pedidos en el extranjero como ser en españa, ella elabora todo lo que le solicitan, los fines de semana se va en busca de las semillas que utiliza en los collares asi como las plumas que necesite, además de eso es profesora de tejido y elaboración de artesanias, ella capacita a las mujeres de su comunidad en tejido, teñido y demas collares y aretes. Es una persona muy proactiva ademas de ser conocida en la zona, esta contenta porque sabe que con este prestamos podra comprar la maquina de costurar que necesita para hacer un mejor trabajo. El deseo de la Sra. Angela es la de ver a sus hijos profesionales y tambien tener su casa propia.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela lives in the Pueblo Nuevo (New Town) zone in Plan 3000. She has 5 children who attend primary and secondary school. She alone maintains the home since she is a single mother and has to work hard to advance her children. Angela makes bags, hammocks, belts, purses, necklaces and hoops which she sells to artisan stores. She also receives many orders from abroad, especially Spain. She makes all they solicit, then on weekends, she goes in search of the seeds used in the necklaces as well as the feathers she needs. In addition, she teaches weaving and how to make artisan goods. Angela teaches the women of her community to weave and die fabrics and make necklaces and ear rings. She is a very proactive person and is very well-known in the zone. She is very content because with this loan she can buy the stitching machine she needs to do better work. Mrs. Angela's desire is to see her children become professionals and also, to have a proper house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A STITCHING MACHINE FOR HER ARTISAN CREATIONS

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
