El comité Los Ángeles está  ubicado en el Barrio  km 7  Monday  Villa Fanny de Ciudad del Este, fue conformado a través de la Sra.  Lidia A. Integran este comité 15 señoras activas y emprendedoras.
El crédito que retiran lo destinaran a la compra de ropas seminuevas, bebidas,embutidos,carne vacuna  y de cerdo, pollo, aceite, arroz ,fideos, productos lácteos, cosméticos, cubiertos, joyas de plata, condimentos, frutas y verduras.
Este crédito solidario le posibilita a  cada una de las señoras tener  un ingreso diario y un trabajo independiente.
Así la señora Silvina se dedica a la venta de ropas seminuevas, esta actividad lo realiza de forma ambulante, recorriendo casa  por casa los diferentes Barrios de la Ciudad y luego viaja hacia el campo para seguir ofreciendo sus mercaderías, es muy sacrificado la actividad que ella realiza para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Comité Los Ángeles” (The Committee of the Angels) is located in the “7 kilometer Monday Villa Fanny” neighborhood in the City of Este. It was cofounded by Lidia. This committee includes 15 active enterprising women. They will use the money from this loan to buy semi-new clothing items, drinks, sausages, beef, pork, chicken, cooking oil, rice, noodles, milk products, cosmetics, kitchen utensils, silver jewelry, condiments, and fruits and vegetables. This loan offers each of these ladies the opportunity to have a daily income while running their own businesses. Silvina sells semi-new clothing door-to-door around the city’s different neighborhoods and in rural areas. She makes many sacrifices in order to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy semi-new clothing items, foodstuffs, houshold goods for resale

loans.name: El Samaritano Group

texts.en:
Modesto is the coordinator of his group, El Samaritano (the Samaritan), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, a poor, agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their one child.

Modesto is excited to be taking his seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business, which is killing weeds in people's gardens. He will purchase five gallons of weed killer and a backpack pump. He will use the profits to invest in his home by fixing his roof as well as in his business. He would like to move his business to a street with more traffic so that he can attract more customers. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer

loans.name: Alfonso Andres

texts.es: Alfonso Andres de 38 años de edad habita en la comarca Calderon jurisdiccion de El Ayote junto a su esposa la Sra. Julia Perez sus 3 hijos de 14,10 y 8 años respectivamente.  Alfonso es pequeño productor que se dedica a la siembra de granos basicos, musaceas, tuberculos y raices, los cuales comercializa y usa para consumo de su familia, pero ademas se dedica al cuido de ganado, esta solicitando su primer credito con el objetivo de comprar 6 terneros de desarrollo, para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos a un mejor precio en donde obtenga ganancias que le permitan mejorar un poco la situacion economica de la familia.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y con la experiencia necesaria para esta actividad.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 14, 10, and 8, in the in the Calderon region of the El Ayote jurisdiction. He is a small producer of basic grains, tubers, and root vegetables, which he sells and also uses to help feed his family. He also raises livestock. He is requesting his first loan in order to be able to buy six calves to fatten up and resell for a profit so that he can improve his family’s financial situation a bit. He has the full support of his family and the necessary experience to be able to accomplish this.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Martha Leonor

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Leonor P. trabaja como asalariada en una escuela que queda en la comunidad de Palacio municipio del Viejo.

Ella va a utilizar el dinero en la ampliación y Reparación de un cuarto, ella tiene de trabajar como profesora de primaria  28 años, y gracias a su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo ha podido educar a sus hijos y así traer el sustento diario al hogar.

Ella dijo que gracias a los créditos que CEPRODEL, le ha otorgado ha venido reparando su casa poco a poco y espera que la Institución la ayude una ves más ya que en el invierno quiere sentirse segura.
texts.en:
Martha Leonor P. works at a school that is located in the Palacio community in the town of Chinandega El Viejo, El Salvador. She will use the loan money to expand and repair a room of her home. Martha has worked as an elementary school teacher for 28 years. Thanks to her work and her husband's help she has been able to raise and educate her children and cover the household expenses. She says that thanks to the loans that CEPRODEL [a Kiva field partner] has given her, she has been able to improve her home bit by bit. She hopes that the field partner will be able to help out once more because during the winter months she would like to feel more secure at home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home expansion and repair.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson M. is a young entrepreneur who is 31 years old.  He has been married to Isabel Ayala for 12 years and the couple has four children:  ages 3, 9, 11, and 12.  The family lives in the San Isidro neighborhood of Coronel Oviedo.  Wilson learned his trade as a repairman from his father Heriberto, and with much sacrifice, decided to go off on his own.  Little by little, he gained clients, and now he has an established client base.  He is seeking a loan to purchase replacement parts for the electronics that he repairs for his clients.  His goal is to open his own workshop to provide his clients with better service.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts

loans.name: Azucena 1 Group

texts.en:
Deysi is the coordinator of her group Azucena, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her five children.

Deysi is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, selling clothing, by purchasing underwear, mosquito nets, pants, blouses and skirts in the main market in Santo Domingo and then selling it in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to proviD. the daily needs for her large family and save for her children's education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, pants, mosquito nets, underwear

loans.name: Estela Claribel

texts.es: Estela Claribel de 40 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 15 y el menor de 12, los cuales estudian. Estela esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, pues necesita reparar el piso y una pared de su casa que se encuentran en mal estado, ademas, si el dinero alcanza desea comprar una puerta y ventanas de su casa para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida quien trabaja como albañil, quien le hara los trabajos que desea.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener su casa bonita con las condiciones necesarias para que su familia viva bien.  Espera contar con el apoyo de AFODENIC y KIVA para realizar este proyecto.
texts.en:
Estela is a 40 year old single mother. Her sons are aged 15 and 12 and attend school. She is requesting her third loan so that she can make improvements to her home. The floor and one wall are in need of repair. If there is enough money left over, she would like to buy a new door and windows so that her family can be more secure. She has the support of her domestic partner who works as a mason and who will do the work for her. She dreams of having a nice home so that her family can live well. She hopes to get support from AFODENIC and KIVA to be able to complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 4 Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas 4 está  ubicado en el Barrio  km 8  Acaray  D. Ciudad del Este, fue conformado a través D. la Sra. Zunilda   R. quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas del barrio. Integran este comité 16 señoras activas y emprendedoras.
El crédito que retiran lo destinaran a la compra D. ropas,bebidas,embutidos,carne vacuna  y D. cerdo,pollo,aceite,arroz ,fideos, productos lácteos,cosméticos,cubiertos,joyas D. plata,condimentos,frutas y verduras, zapatos y zapatillas, accesorios para celulares..
Este crédito solidario le posibilita a  cada una D. las señoras tener  un ingreso diario y un trabajo independiente..
Así como la señora quien se dedica a la venta D. comida en puesto en el mercado municipal D. la ciudad donD. ella prepara sus comestibles y los venD. a la gente que trabaja en el mercado así como a la gente que visita el mercado. En su local ella posee todas las herramientas necesarias para cocinar y en ocasiones es ayudada por la hija y el marido, la venta ayuda muchísimo para los gastos D. la familia..
Se las actividades D. las demás integrantes..
Virginia Verdun
Venta D. comidas.
Zunilda R. D. Ferreira
Venta D. ropa y zapatos.
Atanacia Méreles
Venta D. accesorios para celulares.
Juana D. Jesús V.
Venta D. ropas.
Cándida T. D. Arce
Venta D. ropa.
Rosa Gonzalez D. Ortiz
Venta D. ropa seminueva.
Justina R. D. Rolon
Venta D. comida.
Vicenta Noemí O. 
Venta D.  productos D. limpieza.
Natalia Andrea B.
Venta D. ropa.
ClotilD. Notario D. V.
Venta D. comida.
Maria Elena Rolon
Venta D. ropa.
Olga C.
Venta D. joya.
Maria Ana D.
Despensa.
Deysi Andrea S. 
Venta D. ropas.
Liliana Ramona O.
Venta D. productos D. limpieza.
Liliana R.
Venta D. zapatillas.
texts.en:
The “Comité Mujeres Unidas 4” (Commitee of United Women 4) is located in the “km 8 Acaray” neighborhood of the City of Este. It was co-founded by Zunilda, who contacted her neighborhood friends and neighbors. The group is maD. up of 16 active and enterprising women. They will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, drinks, tripe, beef, pork, chicken, cooking oil, noodles, milk products, cosmetics, kitchen utensils, silver jewelry, condiments, fruits and vegetables, shoes, flip-flops, and cell phone accessories. This loan will give each of these women the opportunity to produce daily incomes while running her own businesses, such as the woman who sells food from a stall in the city marketplace where she prepares her food and sells it to the people working there, as well as those who visit the market. She has all of the cooking tools of her traD.. Sometimes her daughter and her husband help her as well. Her sales help the family tremendously. The other women’s businesses are: Virginia – Food sales Zunilda – Clothing and shoes Atanacia – Cell phone accessories Juana – Clothing sales Cándida – Clothing sales Rosa – Semi-new clothing sales Justina – Food sales Vicenta – Cleaning products sales Natalia – Clothing sales ClotilD. – Food sales Maria – Clothing sales Olga – Jewelry sales Maria – Pantry sales Deysi – Clothing sales Liliana Ramona – Cleaning product sales Liliana – Flip-flop (footwear) sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by Señora Eladia A., a resident of the Primero de Marzo neighborhood in the city of Coronel O.. She had approached Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about its Committee of Enterprising Women program, and then invited her friends and neighbors to form a group in order to get ahead and improve their quality of life. They are 15 very hard-working, humble women who work every day to earn a living. 

They each work independently in clothing sales, food sales, grocery stores, and in orchards; other members sell their own products. 

They received the loan and each person used the money to invest in their respective business. Like the rest of the group members, Señora Ada D. works very hard at her job preparing and selling meals. She wakes up very early each morning to start cooking and display the food she sells from her homes. She used her loan to buy cooking ingredients like beef and chicken, vegetables and spices. 

The group members’ activities are listed below:

1. Bernarda O.: Grocery store 
2. Norma M.: Crafts 
3. Ada D.: Food sales
4. Hilda C.: Avon Cosmetics sales
5. Catalina A.:  Chipa (traditional Paraguayan baked goods) sales
6. Silvia M.: Lingerie sales
7. Maria Liza M.: Street vendor
8. Limpia T.: Fruit and Vegetable sales
9. Rosa C.: Garlic sales
10. Maria Agustina F.: Vegetable sales
11. Marizza S.: Street vendor
12. Eladia A.: Street vendor
13. Juana B.: Garlic sales
14. Gloria B.: Street vendor
15. Victoriana G.: Food sales

loans.use: Buy beef, chicken, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Trabajando Hacia El Bienestar 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Nery is the coordinator of her group 'Trabajando Hacia el Bienestar' (Working Towards Well-being), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in a remote area of the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL., where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Nery is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling gasoline by the liter out of large beer bottles. This is a common business in remote areas of the DR which can be hours from the nearest gas station. She will use the profits to invest in food, notebooks, backpacks, a computer and shoes for her children. Also, she would like to remodel her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: gasoline to sell by the bottle

loans.name: Dionicio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Dionicio G. tiene un taller de Ebanistería y Carpintería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el municipio del viejo.
El va a utilizar el crédito para reparar su vehículo ya que es su medio de transporte que utiliza para el traslado de la madera.
Este es el primer crédito que el Señor G. tiene para con la Institución, pero dice agradecerle a CEPRODEL,  por haberle brindado esta ayuda ya que al reparar su vehículo le genera mayor  ganancia a su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Dionicio G. has a cabinet-making and carpentry workshop in his home, located in the town of El Viejo. He will use this loan to repair his vehicle that he uses for transporting wood. This will be Sr. G.’s first loan with the Institution. He thanks CEPRODEL for providing this assistance in repairing his vehicle so that his business can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs to a vehicle used for transporting wood

loans.name: Israel Guido

texts.es:
El sr. Israel es soltero y vive con sus papas en una casa en anticretico que se encuentra en la zona Quintanilla, la actividad economica que realliza es la venta de calzados de varon por mayor y menor , generalmente  vende por mayor en el interior del paiz como la ciudad de La Paz, Oruro y Potosi. El cliente es de clase media y sencilla , se tiene buenas referencias ya que clientes de la institucion le recomendaron para que pertenesca a Emprender. Con el dinero del credito el Sr. Israel comprara mercaderia para asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo.
El deseo del Sr. Israel es el tener su casa propia y formar una familia estable, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Israel is single and lives with his parents in a house in Anticretico, which is in the zone of Quintanilla. He sells men’s and boy’s shoes. Usually he sells them wholesale in the center of the country such as in the cities of La Paz, Oruro and Potosi. His customers are middle class and humble. He has good recommendations since customers from the business recommend him because he belongs to Emprender. With the money from the loan Mr. Israel will buy merchandise in order to increase his working capital. Mr. Israel would like to have his own home and have a stable family. He is thankful to Emprender and KIVA for their confidence by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Belisario (38), quien se dedica a la agricultura, y de sus 2 hijos: Clisman (13) y Franklin (10).
Desde que era muy pequeña, esta trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la agricultura; en la actualidad siembra maíz, alverja y papa. Le gusta mucho su labor de campo porque ya está acostumbrada a despertarse muy temprano y dirigirse a vigilar sus cultivos, pues sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación puede producir en abundancia. Además, tiene clientes fijos en los mercados que le compran toda su producción y esto le genera buenas ganancias, que junto con su esposo, pueden brindarles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
Y como es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene pensado para el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad para que pueda vender más.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que será puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere defraudar a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, el cual le ayudará a progresar. Bertha tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de semillas de alverja y papa, así como fertilizantes y abono para el cuidado de sus tierras, para que no tenga ningún problema en la próxima cosecha .
texts.en:
Bertha is 38 years old and lives with her husband, Belisario (38), in their own home. He is a farmer and they have two children, Clisman (13) and Franklin (10). Since she was very young, Bertha has been farming and a very hard worker. She currently raises corn, peas, and potatoes. She likes working in the fields because she is used to rising early in the morning and going out to care for her crops. She knows that with some work and dedication, she can produce large harvests. She also has regular customers who buy her entire harvest in the marketplaces. This brings her a good income and she and her husband are able to give a good life to their children. Since she is a hard working woman, she plans to increase her planting so that she can increase her sales. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is certain that she will be able to make her payments on time. She does not want to defraud those people who make this loan possible and who help her to get ahead. She plans to use the money from this loan to buy seed for peas and potatoes, as well as fertilizers to help maintain her land, so that she will not have any problems with her next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr: Ndoumbé N. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants plus trois autres qu'on lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 12 ans et demi et a eu 25 fois de suite bénéficié de prêts. Elle fait un petit commerce, elle vend sur étalage des produits halieutiques, de l'huile de palme, de la pâte d'arachide etc. Ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et d'améliorer le bienêtre familiale.
texts.en:
Ndoumbé N. is a 36-year-old married mother of two children in addition to three others under her care. She has been a member of the Wango Village Bank for 12 ½ years and has received 25 loans through them. She has a small business in which she sells fishing products, palm oil, peanut butter, etc. Her income allows her to pay for her children’s education and improve her family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain and promote her business

loans.name: Elita

texts.es:
Elita, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Percy (39), quien es carpintero, y con sus 3 hijos; Lizeth (17), Johanna (13) y Carol (8).
Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de diversos productos comestibles y bebidas en la tienda que habilitó en su vivienda. Atiende todos los días de la semana, a veces con la ayuda de sus hijas, y las ganancias que obtiene en este negocio son buenas, es por esta razón que puede ayudar a su esposo con el pago de la educación de sus hijas. Paralelamente, también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y conejos de raza, los cuales comercializa en los mercados de la zona donde vive. Este negocio también es rentable, porque el cuidado de estos animales no requiere de mucho sacrificio y su alimentación no es costosa. Para el futuro, quiere ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, así como comprar mayor cantidad de animales y mejorar las jaulas de éstos, porque ya están quedando pequeñas.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir trabajando con esta entidad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su tienda; también adquirirá más animales.
texts.en:
Elita is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Percy (39) who is a carpenter, and their three children, Lizeth (17), Johana (13), and Carol (8). She has been selling various foods and drinks from her home-based store for the past nine years. She works seven days a week with the help of her daughters. She receives a good income from her business, so she is able to help her husband pay for their daughter’s education. She also raises Guinea pigs and rabbits, which she sells in the local marketplace. This business is also profitable because caring for these animals is not difficult and their food is not expensive. In the future she would like to expand her business and buy more animals and expand their cages because they are already too small. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is sure that she will be able to make her payments on schedule, as she would like to continue to work with this group. She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise for her store and more animals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and animals

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika, de 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus hermanos, en una populosa zona de la sierra del Perú.
Desde hace un par de años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca a nivel internacional. Le gusta este negocio porque sabe que tiene una gran capacidad de persuasión, además que brinda los productos al crédito y tiene en stock variedad de productos, que le permiten abastecer a alguna cliente ante cualquier emergencia. 
Su trabajo es tranquilo y le genera buenas ganancias, y como es una mujer joven y emprendedora, tiene planeado en el futuro instalar un pequeño bazar en su vivienda donde ofrezca su mercadería, además de vender otros artículos de uso doméstico y personal.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir accediendo a otros préstamos en adelante. Erika tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes cantidad y variedad.
texts.en:
Erika is 21 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in a well populated area of the Peruvian mountain range. She has been selling an internationally well known brand of beauty supplies for a couple of years. She likes this business because she knows that she is very persuasive. She is able to obtain products on credit and keeps a variety in stock. This allows her to supply customers during any “emergency.” Her work is easy and she makes a good income. She is a very enterprising young woman and plans to set up a small shop in her home, where she will offer her merchandise, as well as other home and personal items. This will be her first loan through MFP and she promises to make her payments on time, as she hopes to be able to receive additional loans in the future. Erika plans to use the money from this loan to invest in large quantities of beauty supplies to keep in stock and be able to offer her customers variety and quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny, de 25 años, vive en la casa de sus padres; con ellos, su pareja José (27), quien es taxista, y su pequeña hija Meybel (3).
Desde muy joven le gustó trabajar en cualquier negocio que se le presentaba, pues su idea es ganar dinero en cualquier actividad, pero honradamente. Anteriormente ayudaba a su madre con sus cultivos, luego empezó a vender bebidas, pero lo que Fanny buscaba era una actividad más rentable. Es así que desde hace unos meses comenzó con la venta de ropa para bebé, al principio tenía muchas dudas, pero ante la demanda adquirió algunos ajuares (conjuntos de lana para bebé) y sus amigas y conocidas le compraron todo. Sus ganancias son muy buenas, ya que los adquiere a precios muy cómodos y los vende ganando un poco más. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar donde pueda ofrecer la ropa para bebé, además de otro tipo de mercadería.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda seguir adelante con sus proyectos. Fanny tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para bebé, ya que quiere seguir en este rubro porque tiene varios pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Fanny, 25 years old, lives in her parents’ house with them and her life partner, 27 year old José. He is a taxi driver. They also live with their small three year old daughter, Meybel. Since she was a young girl she liked working in whatever business was available. Her idea was to earn money in whatever activity, but honorably. She previously helped her mother with the crops. Then she started to sell drinks. But, what Fanny was looking for was a more profitable activity. That is how a few months ago she started selling baby clothes. At first she had a lot of doubts. But, she got some layettes (woolen sets for babies) due to the demand, and her friends and acquaintances bought them all. Her earnings are very good because she gets them at very good prices and sells them to earn a little more. She is a very enterprising woman. In the future she plans to set up a small bazaar where she will be able to offer baby clothes and other types of merchandise. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful to everyone who has made it possible for her to get ahead in her projects. Fanny plans to use the money she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of baby clothes. She wants to continue in this field because she has various orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Karina Evelyn

texts.es: La Sra. Karina vive en anticretico que son propietarios sus papas ubicado en la zona de Quintanilla , tiene como actividad economica la venta de ropa , carteras , zapatos y otros al contado y a credito , generalmente entrega a empresas , instituciones , colegios y otros. no cuenta con tienda ni puesto de venta ella realiza su mercaderia ambulando y ofreciendo puerta a puerta. La cliente es de clase media y sencilla, se tiene buena referencia  por clientes de nuestra institucion. Ella es concubina y tiene dos hijitos pequeños por quienes trabaja bastante para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que sola mantiene a sus hijos porque su pareja se encuentra sin trabajo por el momento, ella es muy trabajadora y con dinero del credito comprara mercaderia y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Karina lives in Anticretico on her parents’ land located in the Quintanilla zone. She sells clothing, wallets, shoes, and other items for cash and credit. She generally sells to people at their jobs, schools, and other places. She does not have a shop nor a stall anywhere; she sells door to door. Her customers are middle class and she has good references from our other clients. She cohabitates and has two small children for whom she works hard to get ahead. She provides the sole means of support for her children, because her partner is unemployed at the moment. She is a hard worker and will use the money from this loan to invest in merchandise and to increase her working capital. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for trusting her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and working capital

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse N. est une femme de 64 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses trois petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO dont elle est la secrétaire depuis 12 ans et demi. Elle a une très bonne expérience en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. elle fait la transformation et vente de bouillie de mil. Son objectif est de payer la formation professionnelle d'un de ses petits fils et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Thérèse N. is a 64-year-old widow who lives with her three grandsons. She has been a member of the Wango Village Bank, where she is the secretary, for 12 ½ years. She has a lot of experience with loans as well as her own business. She makes and sells millet porridge. Her goal is to pay for the professional education of one of her grandsons and to take care of his personal needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further bolster her business

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Pablo esta  ubicado en el Barrio  km 8  Monday de Ciudad del Este,fue conformado a través de la Elida Cuellar quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas del barrio. Integran este comité 17 señoras activas y emprendedoras.
El crédito lo  destinaron a la compra de ropas,bebidas,embutidos,carne vacuna  y de cerdo,pollo,aceite,
arroz ,fideos,productos lácteos,cosméticos,cubiertos,joyas de plata,condimentos,frutas y verduras,zapatos,telas,gomas,
hilos,maiz, en fin de acuerdo a la actividad a que cada una se dedica.
 Así como ejemplo la señora Eligia B. quien destino todo su crédito para la compra de todos los productos en cuanto a cosméticos se refiera, ya que la misma se dedica a su venta, esta actividad ella lo realiza en sus tiempos libres. La venta lo realiza mediante visitas a clientes en su negocio o en su casa. El negocio ayuda bastante para los gastos de la casa especialmente en cuanto alimentación comenta la señora eligia, Agradece a sus amigas del comité por la ayuda constante y a la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Este crédito solidario les posibilita a  cada una de las señoras tener  un ingreso diario y un trabajo independiente.
Juliana B.
Venta y compostura de zapato
Ana Maria C.
Venta de ropa 
Eligia B.
Venta de cosméticos

texts.en:
The San Pablo (St. Paul) Committee is located in the kilometer 8 Monday Barrio, City of Este. It was formed by Elida Cuellar who contacted her neighbors and friends in the barrio. The committee is composed of 17 active and enterprising women. The loan is destined for purchasing clothes, drinks, lace, beef, silver jewelry, condiments, fruit and vegetables, shoes, cloth, glue, thread, and corn; in short, relating to the activity of each member. For example, Mrs. Eligia B. will use her loan to buy all those products related to cosmetics, which is what she sells. She does this in her spare time. Eligia sells by visiting customers in their homes, or in her store. The business helps her considerably with household expenses, especially with food, comments Eligia. She thanks her friends on the committee and at the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation) for their constant help. This solidarity loan makes it possible for each one of these women to have a daily income and independent work. Juliana B. Making and selling shoes Ana Maria C. Clothing sales Eligia B. Cosmetic sales Juana Amancia B. Clothing sales Gloria A. Clothing sales Rosa A. Sale of semi-new clothing Cynthia A. Selling meals Ramona B. Sale of cleaning products Luz N. Clothing sales Laura V. Selling meals Lidia A. Clothing sales Ursulina S. Provisions store Ursulina B. Dring sales Efigenia Lopez Clothing sales Delia B. Corn sales Marcelina L. Dressmaker

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING COLOGNES, MAKE UP, LINEN GOODS, ENAMELS, CREAMS, AND ACCESSORIES

loans.name: Gicela

texts.es:
Gicela, de 34 años, vive en una casa alquilada con sus dos hijos; Anthony (15) y Johanna (1).
Desde hace un par de años se dedica a brindar el servicio de llamadas telefónicas por celular de manera ambulatoria, por las calles de su localidad. Según cuenta es una actividad muy rentable porque tiene 4 celulares y los que alquila a precios muy cómodos de acuerdo al destino donde llaman sus habituales clientes. Le gusta mucho esta actividad porque la realiza en horas fijas, de 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, donde hay más afluencia de público y mayor ganancia, así no descuida a su pequeña hija; tiene además la ayuda de su hijo mayor, quien es muy maduro y trabajador; juntos pagan el alquiler de su casa. Y como es una mujer muy trabajadora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un centro de alquiler de llamadas, para que sea más estable y obtenga mejores ganancias.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y está segura que será muy puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con el grupo que la ha acogido y le ha depositado su confianza. Gicela tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de un equipo celular nuevo. Además de golosinas, pues quiere emprender un negocio ambulante de venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
Gicela is 34 years old and lives in a rented house with her two children, Anthony (age 15) and Johanna (age 1). For the past two years, she has been providing mobile phone services as a traveling vendor through the streets in her neighborhood. She considers her business to be very profitable because she has four cellular phones that she rents out at very reasonable rates and encounters regular customers who need to make phone calls. Gicela enjoys her job because she is able to work regular hours from 7am until 4pm, which is when she can serve most of the general public and earn the most money without having to neglect her young daughter. She also has the help of her oldest son, who is very mature and hardworking. Together they both work to help pay the rent. As a hardworking woman, Gicela has future plans to open a call center so that her business will be more stable and generate more revenue.

This is her first loan with MFP. Gicela will be sure to make each of her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint the other members of her group who have welcomed her and placed their trust in her. She will use the money to purchase a new cellular phone. Gicela wants to start a street vending business selling candy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mobile phone

loans.name: Derma Yesenia

texts.es:
Derma G. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, es divorciada pero tiene una hija de 2 años.

Derma empezó con un capital pequeño que le presto su papa. Compro cremas y ropa poco para tener su propio negocio y así fue incrementando su capital para tener ahora un local de venta de ropa y perfumes.

Ella trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo cremas a $ 17, blusas a $ 8, perfumes desde $ 16. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, perfumes para que su negocio este mas surtido. En el futuro quiere tener más vitrinas y perchas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Derma G. is 35 years old and lives in a periurban district along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil. She is divorced and has a two year old daughter.

Derma started her business using a loan from her father. She bought crèmes and a few articles of clothing to stock her business. Over time, she increased her capital and now has a store where she sells clothes and perfumes.

She begins work very early selling crèmes for $17, blouses for $8, and perfumes for $16. One of the challenges she faces is the amount of crime that occurs in the area. With this loan, she will purchase clothes and perfumes to keep her business stocked. In the future, she hopes to acquire more display cases and clothing racks to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & perfumes

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata N. est une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 12 ans et demi. Elle fait de la restauration et vend des draps de lit qu'elle achète dans les friperies. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales et de participer au bienêtre familial.
texts.en:
Aminata N. is a 32-year-old married mother of two. She has been a member of the Wango Village Bank for 12 ½ years. She repairs and sells bedsheets that she purchases from second-hand stores. Her goal is to help her husband take care of the family’s expenses and to improve her family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos vive en el, municipio de La Guardia, barrio Monte Alto, esta casado y tiene 2 hijitos pequeños su actividad es la de venta de productos de primera necesidad ambulante en los mercados, no cuenta con domicilio propio por lo tanto vive en la casa de su suegra, es una pareja joven con mucha ganas de superación, por lo que recurrió a la institución para acceder a su primer crédito financiero, lo recomendo otro cliente de la institucion teniendo buenas referencias por su responsabilidad y ganas de trabajar se le otorgo el credito, uno de sus deseos es de tener su propio puesto de venta y tambien comprarse su casita, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the municipality of La Guardia, in the Monte Alto neighborhood. He is married and has 2 small children. He is a street vendor who sells products that are basic necessities in the markets. He does not have his own home, so he lives in his mother-in-law's house. He is a young husband who has a strong desire to succeed. For this reason he turned to the institution to access his first loan. Another client of the institution recommended him, and having good references for his responsibility and desire to work hard, he was given the loan. One of his wishes is to have his own stall where he can sell, and also to buy his own little house. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor, de 63 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Alicia (52) y su hija Catherine (33), pues su hijo menor Christopher (22) no vive con ellos.
Hace 6 años instaló en su vivienda una pequeña tienda de comestibles donde vende toda clase de golosinas, snack, gaseosas y otros comestibles de primera necesidad. Se animó con este negocio porque no había competencia por la zona donde vive y como no encontraba trabajo debido a un problema que tiene en el oído decidió tener un negocio propio. Ésta es una actividad tranquila, además la realiza con la ayuda de su esposa y de su hija. Y a pesar de su edad tiene muchos proyectos en mente para mejorar la calida de vida de su familia.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por  lo que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir sacando préstamos con esta entidad. Héctor tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mercadería para surtir mejor su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Héctor is 63 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Alicia (age 52) and their daughter Catherine (age 33). His younger son Christopher (age 22) does not live with them.

Six years ago, he opened a small grocery store in his home where he sells different kinds of candy, snacks, sodas, and other basic necessities. He was encouraged by the fact that his business would not face any other competition in the area. Héctor decided to start his own business since he had trouble finding work because of problems with his hearing. He finds managing his business to be quite peaceful and also has the help of his wife and daughter. Despite his age, Héctor has many projects planned to improve the quality of life for his family.

This is his first loan with MFP. Héctor promises to complete each of his payments on time because he wants to receive subsequent loans for as long as he can. He plans to use the money he requested to buy merchandise so that he can increase his inventory and offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase his inventory

loans.name: Licett

texts.es:
Licett, de 28 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de su pequeño hijo Jordan (4). 
Desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a múltiples oficios, pues lo que busca es ganar dinero de manera honrada para mantener a su hijo. Generalmente le gusta el comercio, es por eso que ha elegido la venta por campaña, en este caso: biblias.
Esta actividad le resulta muy rentable, pues tiene bastante demanda, sobretodo en los colegios y parroquias de su localidad. Lo que no le agrada de su actividad es tener que caminar tantas horas ofreciendo su mercadería, pues estas biblias son grandes y pesadas. 
Para el futuro, tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar en su vivienda, donde pueda hacer realidad el sueño del negocio propio, ya que sabe que las ventas son su especialidad y está segura que le irá bien por la capacidad de persuasión que posee.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable y puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir trabajando con su banco comunal. Licett tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de más biblias, ya que quiere continuar con este negocio por las buenas ganancias que obtiene.
texts.en:
Licett is 28 years old and lives at home with her parents and her young son Jordan (age 4). For the past two years, she has held multiple jobs in order to earn an honest income to support her son. Overall, Licett enjoys the retail sector, so for this season she decided to sell Bibles.

This activity turns out to be quite profitable since there is adequate demand around the schools and parishes in the area. What she doesn’t like about her job is walking several hours presenting the Bibles because they are big and heavy. In the future, she plans to open a bazaar in her home so that she can fulfill her dream of owning a business. She knows that sales is her specialty and is confident in her ability to persuade people.

This is her first loan with MFP. Licett promises to be responsible and punctual with each of her payments because she wants to continue working with her Communal Bank. She plans to use the money to buy more Bibles so that she can continue with this business and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Bibles to sell

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou D. est âgé de 43 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec ses 6 enfants et ses deux femmes dans le quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur Seydou abandonna l’école en classe de sixième année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de céréales. 
Seydou est très sollicité et jouit d’une grande notoriété dans les activités d’achat et de  vente de céréales.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son cinquième prêt individuel, après  avoir correctement  remboursés les quatre précédents.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 8 tonnes de céréales sèches (fonio, arachides, haricot, petit mil maïs). 
Il s’approvisionne sur place  à  Fana ville et dans les villages environnants à un prix abordable pour venir les revendre dans sa boutique sise au grand marché de Fana quand les articles auront de la valeur, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou D. is 43 years old and lives in a polygamous family with his six children and two wives in the Banankabougou neighbourhood, part of the Fana sous-préfecture, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Seydou left school in the sixth grade (Mali education system) to embark on revenue-generating activities, in particular the commerce of cereals. Seydou is quite in demand and has acquired a solid reputation in buying and selling cereals. With an eye on satisfying his ever-increasing customer base, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI where he is at his fifth loan request, having correctly reimbursed the four previous ones. He wants to use this loan to buy eight tons of dry cereal (fonio, peanuts, beans, millet, and corn). He gets his supplies locally at reasonable prices, in the town of Fana and in surrounding villages, and resells them when the products have increased in value. His store is located at the major market of Fana, and his customers are mainly resellers from the large cities. He hopes to reach an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be used for family expenses and the remainder invested in his business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: But cereals

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Rosalie D. est la présidente du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 12 ans et demi, elle est âgée de 61, veuve et ne vit qu'avec sa petite fille, tous ses enfants sont majeurs et sont parti se marier. Elle fait de la couture sur mesures à domicile. Son objectif est de pouvoir se prendre en charge et de répondre aux besoins de sa petite fille.
texts.en:
Rosalie D. has been the president of the Wango « Banc Villageois » loan group for 12 ½ years. She is 61 years old, a widow, and only lives with her grand-daughter, since her children have all left to get married. She does custom sewing in her home. Her objective is to be able to take care of her own needs and those of her grand-daughter.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her sewing activity

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, D. 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. sus dos hijos; Jean Carlo (18) y Piero (14). Se separó D. su cónyuge y menciona que se ha dado cuenta que soL. pueD. salir adelante.
Hace 4 años se decidió a instalar una tienda D. comestibles en L. cochera D. su casa y desD. entonces ha progresado mucho. En este negocio ofrece todo tipo D. comestibles; golosinas, snack, abarrotes en general y bebidas. Adicionalmente prepara desayunos y almuerzos para algunos habituales comensales, pues gracias a su ingenio ha adaptado una mesita bajo un toldo afuera D. su tienda y ahí sirve sus deliciosos platillos. Margarita trabaja soL., tanto en su tienda como en su puesto D. comidas. Con ambas actividades obtiene buenas ganancias, con las que pueD. ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad D. vida. Siendo una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio D. venta D. comidas e instalarlo en otro lugar y contratar a una ayudante.

Este es el 2do préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura D. que cumplirá con el pago puntual D. cada una D. sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir progresando D. L. mano con estos créditos. Margarita tiene planeado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en L. compra D. mayor cantidad D. cervezas, ya que durante las fiestas locales tienen bastante demanda y a veces no se da abasto.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her two chidren, Jean Carlo (age 18) and Piero (age 14). She is separated from her husband and says it is possible to succeed alone.

Four years ago, she opened a grocery store in the garage of her house and has maD. good progress since that time. She offers all types of food products: candy, snacks, groceries, and beverages. In addition, Margarita prepares breakfast and lunch for some of her regular customers. Thanks to an idea she had, she set up a table underneath an awning outsiD. of her store where she can serve her delicious meals. Margarita works by herself, both in her store and at her food stand. Both activities generate good earnings, so she is able to proviD. her children with a good quality of life. Being such an enterprising woman, Margarita has plans for the future to expand her food business by opening another location and hiring an assistant.

This is her second loan with MFP. Margarita is sure to make each of her payments on time because wants to keep progressing with each of her loans. She plans to use the money to purchase as much beer as she can to sell during the local festivals because sometimes the demand exceeds the available supply.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer to sell

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou Fané est âgé de 57 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec ses huit enfants et ses 2 femmes dans le quartier Banankabougou courani, sous préfecture de Fana, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur Seydou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Très tôt il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de céréales. Seydou est très sollicité et jouit d’une grande notoriété dans les activités d’achat et de  vente de céréales.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après  avoir correctement  remboursé le premier.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 7 tonnes de céréales de différentes sortes à un prix abordable pour venir les revendre dans sa boutique, au grand marché de Fana, quand les céréales auront du prix, en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales de la ville.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou Fané is 57 years old. He lives in a polygamous family with his eight children and two wives in the Banankabougou Courani neighbourhood of the Fana sous-préfecture, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Seydou has not been to school. At an early age he became interested in revenue-generating activities, in particular the commerce of cereals. He is in high demand and enjoys a great reputation in the business of buying and selling cereals. Aiming to satisfy an increasing number of clients, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where he is now requesting a second loan, having fully reimbursed the first one. He will use this loan to buy seven tons of a variety of cereals, at a low price. He will then resell them retail and for cash, in his store at the main market of Fana, when the cereal prices are higher. His customer base spans all social categories in town. He hopes to reach an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will serve to cover family expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in his activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereals

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Alejandro (41) y de sus 4 hijos; Daysi (19), Jordan (17), Ruth (15) y Alejandro (13).
Hace un año instaló una tienda de comestibles en la cochera de su casa y le ha ido muy bien, pues en poco tiempo ha podido ampliarla. Aún recuerda cuando empezó, solo contaba con algunas cosas en su pequeña tienda, estaba casi vacía. Ahora, en la actualidad, vende variedad de productos: abarrotes, bebidas, y hace poco tiempo ha empezado con la venta de gas (doméstico). A Marlene le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se distrae bastante, aunque no puede salir mucho por atender la tienda; además por las ventas obtiene buenas ganancias que le permiten comprar cosas necesarias para su hogar. Y como es una mujer que no corre del trabajo duro, para futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda y surtirla de mayor cantidad de productos, para que sus clientes encuentren en su negocio todo lo que necesiten.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda seguir adelante con su negocio. Marlene tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su tienda, también adquirirá cuadernos, que por campaña escolar, se venden bastante bien.
texts.en:
Marlene is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Alejandro (age 41) and their four children: Daysi (age 19), Jordan (age 17), Ruth (age 15) and Alejandro (age 13).

One year ago, Marlene opened a store in the garage of her home and has done very well. Over time she has expanded her business. She still remembers that when she first opened, her shop was almost empty because she had few items in stock. Today she sells a variety of products such as groceries, beverages, and most recently gas (for home use). Marlene enjoys her work because it provides a distraction. However, she is not able to get out much because she has to attend to the store, which generates good profits that allow her to buy necessities for her home. Since she is a woman who is not afraid of hard work, Marlene has plans to expand her facilities and stock her business with a greater quantity of products because her customers rely on her business to provide everything they need.

This is her first loan with MFP. Marlene is very grateful to everyone who has made it possible for her to move forward with her business. She plans to use the money to buy more merchandise to restock her shop. In addition, she will buy notebooks for the school season since they sell very well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Wilson Higidio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Wilson, pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio se dedica al comercio minorista, él es separado y tiene 46 años de edad, el socio tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad, Nuestro socio tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones y ha comprado anteriormente las maquinas industriales, ahora él socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar telas para el negocio. Nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para comprar telas para su taller.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Wilson is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vision de Urubamba” (New Vision of Urubamba). He lives in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas in Urubamba, located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Wilson is 46 years old, separated from his wife, and has two children (ages 20 and 16). He manages a small sewing workshop that is equipped with industrial machines that he previously purchased. He is requesting a loan in order to buy fabric for his business.

Wilson is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 5 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió hasta primer año de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de coca (planta medicinal) y golosinas.

Juliana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar coca y golosinas.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y abrir una tienda de abarrotes. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la asistencia a las reuinones de cada mes.
texts.en:
Sra. Juliana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Calceteras” for five years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 54 years old, widowed, and has two children. Juliana studied through the first year of high school and currently makes a living by buying and selling coca leaves (for medicinal purposes) and candy.

She says that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount 300 soles and used to increase her operating capital. Juliana is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy coca leaves and candy. Her dreams for the future are to improve her business and eventually open a grocery store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings accounts and attending her monthly meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coca leaves & candy

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Martha, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luciano (31) y de sus 2  hijos; Luzbeth (11) y Dayma (5).
Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron las técnicas de la agricultura, es por eso que cuando se casó y formó su propia familia no dudó en ayudar a su esposo con el sustento del hogar, sembrando maíz en grandes cantidades. Le gusta mucho la labor de campo, ya que sabe muy bien cómo se realiza y le da buenas ganancias, pues el maíz que cosecha lo vende a un molino de la zona y tiene el dinero asegurado. Lo que no le agrada es que tiene que estar en constante vigilancia de sus cultivos, pues son asediados por los pájaros que destruyen gran cantidad de su producción. Pero aun así le agrada mucho sembrar para después ver el fruto de su esfuerzo en los dorados granos. Y como es una mujer muy laboriosa, que siempre se proyecta al futuro, tiene planeado sembrar otro tipo de vegetales en sus tierras para incrementar su producción.

Esta es la 1ra vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y promete será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere atrasarse y dejar mal al grupo de trabajo que le ha depositado su confianza. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de alverja y papa, así como fertilizantes y abono para el cuidado de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marta is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Luciano (age 31) and their two children, Luzbeth (age 11) and Dayma (age 5).

As a young girl, Marta’s parents taught her the techniques used in farming. When she got married and started her own family, she did not hesitate in helping her husband with supporting their household. She utilized her skills by planting corn in large quantities. Marta enjoys working in the fields and knows what is needed to succeed and generate good profits. She sells her crop of corn to the local mill and earns the money to provide security for her family. The part of the job she dislikes is the need to constantly monitor the crops because birds have been known to destroy a large part of her harvest. Even with this inconvenience, she enjoys seeing the golden kernels that are the fruits of her labor. Marta is a very industrious woman who always looks to the future. She plans to grow other types of vegetables on her land in order to increase her production.

This is her first loan from MFP. Marta promises to be punctual in making her payments because she does not want to create tension and ill feelings among the other group members who have placed their trust in her. She will use the money to purchase seeds for growing peas and potatoes, as well as fertilizer and compost for maintaining her land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr: Émilie S. est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 8 ans et a eu à bénéficier successivement de 16 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait du petit commerce de produits halieutiques et d'huile de palme. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Émilie S. is 53 years old, married and the mother of seven children, all under her care. She has been a member of the Wango “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past eight years and has been granted 16 successive loans, all of which were well managed and regularly repaid. She runs a small business selling seafood and palm-nut oil. Her aim is to participate in managing family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Leonel,  pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio  tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos (14, 3) es conviviente y se dedica al comercio minorista, nuestro socio antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa que traía desde Lima, ahora el socio cría pollos y los vende de maduros, el socio dice que este negocio nuevo le será rentable porque estudió todo el mercado y ya tiene compradores. Nuestro socio desea el préstamo para comprar pollos.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Leonel is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vision de Urubamba” (New Vision of Urubamba). He lives in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas in Urubamba, located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Leonel is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 14 and 3). He has a small business in which he sells clothing shipped in from Lima. Now he wants to raise chickens and sell them when they mature. Leonel says this new business will be profitable because he has studied the market and has already lined up buyers. He is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens.

Leonel is appreciative of this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to raise

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Koné est âgé de 32 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec ses deux enfants et son époux dans le quartier Badialan,  de la ville de Fana, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Madame Fatoumata, en plus de sa profession d’enseignante, excelle dans les activités de fabrication de boissons non alcoolisées notamment les jus de fruits. Fatoumata est très sollicitée, appréciée et jouit d’une grande notoriété.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement  remboursé le  premier.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  20 sacs de zaban, un sac de sucre, des paquets de colorants, d’arômes, des sachets plastiques et deux sacs de dah rouge. 
Il s’approvisionne  essentiellement à Fana et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle fait vendre ses jus de boissons non alcoolisées, de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Koné is 32 years old. She lives in a monogamous household with her husband and two children in the Badialan neighbourhood of Fana, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. In addition to being a teacher, Mrs. Fatoumata excels in the production of non-alcoholic beverages, particularly fruit juices. She is in high demand for her products, well appreciated and enjoys an excellent reputation. With the desire to satisfy a growing number of customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI where she is now requesting a second loan, having correctly reimbursed the first one. She will use the loan to buy: 20 bags of saba concentrate (a local fruit variety), one bag of sugar, packages of food coloring, flavour extracts, plastic bags and two bags of red roselle concentrate. She gets her supplies mainly from Fana and sometimes Bamako (the capital of Mali). She sells her non-alcoholic fruit juices as an itinerant vendor in the different areas of town, to a customer base of both men and women. She hopes to reach an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to assist her husband deal with family expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for fruit juices

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Juan Felipe T. P. es originario de la comunidad el coyol municipio de condega se dedica a actividades agrícolas y ganaderas su finca tiene una extensión de 130 mz de terreno siendo estas mas a la actividad de ganado, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de mantenimiento de café como compra de abono ya que este cliente cuenta con un área de ocho mz de café el cual se dedica a cultivarlas de la mejor manara posible para sacarle un buen provecho a este rubro ya que es una delas principales actividades de los nicaragüenses   
Su negocio comenzó desde niño ya que su papá se dedicaba a cultivar este rubro y aprendió de él ,hoy en día ya no cuenta con la ayuda de su papá pero siempre cultiva el patrimonio que él le dejo. Este cliente también se dedica a otras actividades como cultivo de granos básicos y ganadería y  espera que con el crédito  le  vaya muy bien porque tendrá más oportunidad de seguir trabajando y mantener su finca cada ves mas en mejores condiciones ya que su meta es tener es dejarle un buen patrimonio a sus hijos. 
Don Juan Felipe es casado y tiene seis hijos dos edad escolar y  cuatro mayores de edad que ya no dependen de él pero siempre les brida su apoyo como padre. Este es sexto crédito que se le otorga y trabaja con ceprodel desde el año dos mi cinco y nos expreso que esta agradecido con la institución por la ayuda que se le a brindado ya que a mejorado sus condiciones de vida de su familia y espera seguir trabajando de la misma forma con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Juan Felipe T. P. is originally from the community of Coyol, municipality of Condega. He makes a living as an agricultural and livestock farmer on his own land. He is most active in livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizers for his coffee crops, since a portion of his land is dedicated to coffee and he wants to cultivate it in the best way possible to make the most of it. Coffee is one of the main activities of Nicaraguans. He has been involved in the business since he was a young boy because his father also made a living off the same land. Juan Felipe learned from him, and today he doesn't have his father to count on but he will always work on the land that he left him. Juan Felipe also dedicates himself to other activities, such as cultivating basic grains and raising livestock, and he hopes that the loan will give him more opportunities to keep working and improving the conditions of his farm a little more each time. His goal is to leave a legacy for his children. Juan Felipe is married and has six children, two school age and four who are fully grown and no longer dependent on him but whom he always supports as a father. This is his sixth loan, and he has worked with Kiva partner Ceprodel since 2005. He expressed his gratitude for helping him improve his family's quality life, and he hopes to keep working with the same success with Kiva and Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to maintain coffee crops

loans.name: Giovanna Carmen

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Giovanna, pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestra socia está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 35 años de edad y ella tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, nuestra socia es casada y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ella  tiene su stand en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, otros productos), la socia ayuda económicamente a la crianza de sus hijos y a a la alimentación de la familia, nuestra socia desea que su negocio prospere y que la calidad de vida de su hogar sea cada vez mejor.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member, Giovanna, belongs to the NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA community bank. She lives in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas, Urubamba, about an hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Giovanna is 35 years old, married and has 2 children, 15- and 10-years old. She spends part of her day running the family home and part of her day operating her retail business, a small grocery. She has a stand in Urubamba's model market. Our member needs the loan to buy merchadise (rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc.) that she will resell to her customers. Her income goes to raising her children and feeding her family. Her greatest hopes are that her business prospers and that she can improve her family's quality of life. Giovanna is grateful for the opportunities that micro-lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Reyna, pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella se dedica desde hace algún tiempo al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende ropa, al por mayor y menor, La socia viaja a la frontera entre Perú y Bolivia, compra en desahuadero ropa al por mayor y lo trae a vender a Urubamba, Nuestra socia tiene un stand en el centro comercial Sr. De Torrechayoc stand A-16; La socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer mercadería y ropa escolar.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member, Reyna, belongs to the NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA community bank. She lives in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas, Urubamba, about an hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Reyna is 26 years old and single with no children. She has operated a business, buying and selling clothes, for both the retail and wholesale markets for some time. She travels to the border with Bolivia, buys wholesale supplies of clothing at Desaguadero and brings them back to Urubamba to sell. She has a stand in the Sr. De Torrechayoc commercial market, stand A-16. Our member is applying for a loan to pay for a trip to buy school clothing that she will bring back and sell. Reyna is grateful for the opportunity that micro-lending provides her and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Jefferson Stalyn

texts.es:
Jefferson Camposano de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene un hijo de 4 años.

Jefferson empezó trabajando en el carro de su papa como taxista ambulante, cuando reunió dinero se compro su propio carro.

Ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 trabajando como taxista ambulantes en Guayaquil. También realiza la actividad de mecánico para tener otro ingreso extra para su familia. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena y piedras para poder construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere tener su propia cooperativa de taxis.
texts.en:
Jefferson Camposano, 26, lives on the outskirts of the Ecuadorean city of Guayaquil. He owns his own house with access to all the basic services. His wife runs the family home and cares for their 4-year old son. Jefferson has been working as a cab driver, driving a car owned by his father. When he has enough money, he will buy his own car. For now, he works the streets and avenues of Guayaquil from 7:00 in the morning to 10:00 at night. He also works as a mechanic in order to make extra income to support his family. The biggest problem he faces is crime. Jefferson will use the loan to buy cement, sand and stone so that he can make improvements to his house. In the future, he wants to own his own taxi business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Carmen, se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio  km 8 Monday de Ciudad del Este, fue conformado a través de la Sra. Mirian Avalos. Integran este comité 15 señoras activas y emprendedoras.
El crédito lo destinaron a la compra de  ropas,bebidas,embutidos,carne vacuna  y de cerdo, pollo, aceite, arroz, fideos, productos lácteos, cosméticos, bijouterias, joyas de plata, condimentos, frutas y verduras.
La señora Petrona F. quien tiene una despensa donde tiene una despensa con todos los productos de la canasta básica familiar, la despensa es atendida por toda la familia y ayuda bastante para los gastos de la casa. 
Este crédito solidario le posibilita a  cada una de las señoras tener  un ingreso diario y un trabajo independiente.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen committee, in the Kilometer 8 Monday neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, was organized by Sra. Mirian Avalos. The committee has 15 members, all active, entrepeneurial women. The loan will be used to buy clothing, beverages, canned meats, beef and pork, chicken, cooking oil, rice, pasta, dairy products, cosmetics, costume jewelry, silver jewelry, condiments, fruits and vegetables, products that the women will resell. Sra. Petrona F. owns a small shop where she sells the products that are basic fare for local families. The entire family helps to run the shop and revenues from the business pay most of their everyday expenses. This loan improves the chances that each of these women will have a regular income and be able to work for themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Pablo Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo M. es un agricultor que vive en palacio una comunidad del Viejo, Quien tiene una granja camaronera ubicada a 25km  de Morazán, (Palacio).
El Sr. esta solicitando este crédito para darle mantenimiento a la granja ya que  va a sembrar y necesita darle todo el mantenimiento necesario para sacer una buena cosecha.

El actualmente tiene 12 cabezas de ganado los cuales le ayudan a el a llevar el sustento a su hogar, además siembra maíz para tener mayores ingresos y así cumplir con sus obligaciones.

El ha tenido 5 créditos con la institución  los cuales le han ayudado mucho ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha brindado CEPRODEL, ha venido engrandeciendo su ganadería y su granja camaronera.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo M. is a farmer who lives in the community of Palacio in El Viejo. He has a shrimp farm located 25km from Morazán (in Palacio). The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his farm and provide it with everything necessary to ensure a good output.

Pablo also has twelve heads of cattle which help to support his household. In addition, he plants corn in order to generate more income to meet his obligations.

Pablo has taken out five loans with CEPRODEL which have helped him greatly. He thanks CEPRODEL for providing assistance in expanding both his livestock operation and his shrimp farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inputs for maintaining his shrimp farm

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia, es una mujer muy soñadora, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 64 años, es madre de sietes hijos, dos son dependientes, ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, esta actividad la realiza en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda en el trabajo de criar las gallinas. Lastenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace tres ciclos, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de alimentos para sus gallinas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en el acondicionamiento de un lugar en su casa para que pueda vender comida. La meta de Lastenia es tener una bodega en su casa donde pueda vender de todo.
texts.en:
Lastenia is a woman with big dreams. She lives in the Yarinacocha district of Ucayali. She is 64 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom still live with her. She makes a living raising chickens, a business that she runs from her house. Her husband helps her with the business.
