Lastenia has been a member of the Las Dinamicas community bank for three funding cycles. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy chicken feed. She now needs a 1000-soles loan that she will use to renovate a space in her house to sell food. Lastenia's goal is to own a shop in her house where she can sell everything.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop a space at home for food sales.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela, es una mujer muy ordenada, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de dos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como obrero. Mariela forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las activas”, desde hace 3 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de materiales e insumos para su negocio, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 400 soles, que será reinvertido en la compra de materiales e insumos para la venta de comida. La meta a corto plazo de Mariela es poner una brosteria.  Para el futuro piensa poder tener una pollería.
texts.en:
Mariela is a very orderly lady. She lives in the Calleria district, Ucayali region. She is 31, and the mother of 2 young children. She works selling prepared food which she makes in her home. Her husband, a laborer, is supportive of her business. Mariela has been a member of the communal bank “Las activas” for 3 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to buy ingredients for her business. Now she needs a loan of 400 soles that she will use to buy materials and ingredients to sell the food. Her short term goal is to set up for selling broasted chickens. In the future she would like to have a poultry store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use the loan for the purchase of materials and ingredients to sell her food

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Cecilia, pertenecen al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestra socia está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años y es viuda, la socia tiene  4 hijos de  28, 26, 24, 15 años de edad; nuestra socia es docente de nivel primario en una escuela de la provincia de Urubamba, la socia es comerciante minorista, ella se dedica entre sus otras actividades a la compra y venta de cuyes, la socia cría cuyes, los reproduce y luego los vende, ella desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que es la única que los ha estado apoyando en todo, Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y algunas aves de corral.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Cecilia belongs to the “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA” ("New Vision of Urubamba") communal bank. She lives in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas; Urubamba is 1 hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Our partner Cecilia is 52 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children, aged 28, 26, 24 and 15. She is an elementary school teacher at a school in Urubamba province. She is also a retail seller. Among her other activities, she buys and sells guinea pigs, and she also breeds and raises guinea pigs to sell. Her desire is to give her children a better quality of life, since she has been the only one supporting them. Cecilia needs a loan to purchase more guinea pigs as well as some domestic fowl. Cecilia is grateful for the opportunity provided to her, and she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing guinea pigs and domestic fowl

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, es una mujer muy paciente, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 43 años, es madre de cuatro hijos y dos dependen de su cuidado, ella se dedica a la costura, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es policía. Gladys forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace tres ciclos, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de telas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será invertido en la compra de telas, elásticos y otros materiales necesarios para la costura. La meta de Gladys es implementar la actividad que realiza adquiriendo implementos como: una maquina mini industrial, una remalladora, etc.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very patient woman who lives in the Yarinacocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are still in her care. She works at home as a tailor, with the support of her husband, who is a policeman. Gladys has been a member of the “Las Dinámicas” ("The Dynamic Ones") communal bank for three loan cycles. She invested her first loan, for 300 Peruvian soles, in purchasing fabric. Now she needs a loan of 800 soles, which she will invest in buying fabric, elastic strips and other materials necessary for her tailoring work. Gladys' goal is to continue developing her business by acquiring equipment such as a mini-industrial sewing machine, an embroidering machine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric, elastic bands and other materials to make clothing

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto T. Blandón, tiene una propiedad de 8 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 2 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos(frijol y maíz), 6 manzanas área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado,
Este tipo de producto lo comercializa a compradores directos que llegan en camión a comprar granos a las comunidades. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de un torete para desarrollarlo, el necesita comprar este torete para hacer una yunta de dos bueyes ya que el solo tiene uno y con la compra de este otro torete hará la yunta que necesita para labrar la tierra en el momento de la siembra o ciclo agrícola,  ya que él hace las labores de preparación de suelo para la siembra de sus granos básicos de forma artesanal ósea para sembrar el tiene que romper o arar el suelo esto se puede hacer con maquinaria ( tractor pero es más costoso y no hay este tipo de maquinas  en la zona o comunidad), entonces lo hace con dos bueyes y el solo tiene uno le hace falta el otro,  esto le afecta porque en  época de siembra tiene que alquilar o pagar a otros productores para que le presten y hagan este trabajo, pero  esto  lo hacen hasta que ellos ya han terminado de sembrar por lo que  este cliente tiene que esperar y sembrar hasta después, esto puede ocasionarle la pérdida del ciclo agrícola o época de siembra. El negocio lo comenzó desde que era pequeño sembrando en las tierras de sus padres ahí el adquirió experiencia y con los ahorros que él hace compro 4 manzanas que corresponden a una parte del terreno y la otra parte se la heredaron sus padres, este cliente su principal actividad de trabajo es la agricultura esto lo hace dos veces al año en el ciclo 1- ciclo de primera que inicia en mayo y termina en agosto que es cuando saca la cosecha, el ciclo 2- ciclo de postrera comprendido del el inicio en septiembre y termina en diciembre, estas son las épocas de cosecha agrícola que se dan solamente en invierno, Entonces con la compra de este torete tendrá los dos bueyes que necesita y de esta forma el espera tener en tiempo de invierno sus bueyes y poder sembrar en el momento que el así lo desee con forme al ciclo agrícola. 
Don Rigoberto T., ha tenido 2créditos para esta actividad de trabajo que es parte muy importante en esta actividad o sector económico, lleva 2 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo obteniendo beneficios que le dan una mejor forma de realizar sus labores de siembra dándole como resultado garantizar su siembra de granos y mayores ingresos de esta forma el va mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida como pequeño productor.
texts.en:
Rigoberto T. Blandón has property measuring 8 manzanas (traditional Central American unit of measurement) that’s divided into several areas for use: two manzanas are for farming (corn and beans) and six manzanas are for cattle raising. This type of product is sold to direct buyers that come in their trucks to the communities to buy grains. He will use the funds to buy a bullock to raise. He needs to buy the bull so that he can make a two-ox team. He only has one now and needs a second one in order to have the team to plow his farmlands for planting. He, himself, does all the land preparation for planting in an artisanal way; in other words, he could plow the land with machinery (a tractor is more expensive and that type of machinery is unavailable in his area). So, he does it with two oxen but he only has one and he needs the other one. This affects him adversely because when the planting season approaches, he has to lease or pay others to do this service for him. However, they are only available to him after they finish their own plowing and planting so he has to wait to plant even later. This can cause him to lose the planting cycle. He started the business as a young boy farming his parents’ lands. That is where he gained experience. He used his savings to buy 4 manzanas, which correspond to part of his total spread; the other part he inherited from his parents. This client’s main occupation is farming. He does this twice a year: Cycle One: Spring, May to August; Cycle Two: Post-Season, from September to December. These are winter agricultural harvest seasons. With the purchase of this bull, he will have the two bulls he needs and will have the bulls available in winter so that he can plant at the moment he desires according to the planting cycle. Rigoberto T. has had two previous loans for this activity, which is very important in this economic sector. He has collaborated with Ceprodel for two years. These loans have had important positive impact in that they made it possible for him to improve his farming activities obtaining benefits that give him a better way to do his planting activities. As a result, his crops insure larger income so that gradually he improves his standard of living as a small producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bullock.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa Esperanza tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedican a este negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento que tiene con Fundación León 2000, por lo que ha sido una experiencia maravillosa pues ha sido de gran ayuda. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, Josefa es una mujer muy humilde, por lo que su actividad está ubicada en su vivienda ella tiene que ir al mercado en busca de los productos, por lo que permanece todo el día en su casa para atender a sus clientes. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, refrescos y gaseosas. Ella sueña con incrementar su negocio y lograr acondicionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Josefa Esperanza is 49 years old. She has a mini-market. She has had this business for over five years. This is not her first loan with Fundación León 2000. It has been a marvelous experience; it has been a great help. Her business is a mini-market. Josefa is a very modest woman, and her business is located in her house. She has to go to the market to look for the products, and she stays in her house all day to wait on her customers. She is requesting this loan in order to buy sweets, natural cold drinks, juices, refreshments, and soft drinks. She dreams of increasing her business and being able to fix up her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama violetas porque dicen las señoras  que es una flor muy bonita y que  aparte  esta conformado por  mujeres. Esta  ubicado en Tierra Blanca.  El grupo esta integrado  por 4 señoras emprendedoras  que se  conocen  hace mas de 24 años. Este  es su ciclo numero 1  en  Fundación Realidad.

La representante del grupo se llama Angélica Araceli F. Gutiérrez.  Ella tiene 38 años y termino únicamente la primaria, tiene 2 hijos- una niña  y un  niño. Ella se dedica  a  la venta  de zapatos, regalos, bolsas y bisutería.  Necesita el préstamo  para  reinvertir en bolsas  y regalos. Comenta que tiene muchas clientas  a  las cuales  les ofrece un extenso surtido de productos ,dice  que desde muy chica  se ha dedicado a  esta actividad que mejoro la calidad de  vida de sus padres  y ahora mejora la calidad de  vida de sus  hijos  y esposo.

Mónica M. Marrón también pertenece al grupo  las  violetas. Tiene 41  años de edad y estudio la secundaria , y únicamente tiene una hija.  Mónica se dedica a  la venta de  productos de  belleza  de la marca mary  kay  e  invertirá  el crédito en estos productos. Ya que dice le  han generado ganancias  con las cuales  mejora día a día  y que sus  clientes estas convencidos  que es un buen producto  y esta actividad  le ayuda a conocer  mas  gente.

Victoria F.  C. se dedica a la venta de  tacos,  y quiere el  préstamo para resurtirse de   materia prima para elaborar  sus  tacos. Lilia  Hernández Álvarez  es le nombre de la ultima  integrante.  Ella se dedica  a  la venta de perfumes  originales , comenta  que es un gran apoyo que tiene, ya que  le gusta tener su propia ganancia  y poder le dar una  buena  educación a su hija  , el préstamo otorgado lo ocupara  para reinvertir en perfumería.  Todas estan muy agredicidas a las personas de KIVA que estan apoyandolas.
texts.en:
The name of this group is “Violetas”. The women say this is because it is a very pretty flower and it is comprised of women. It is located in Tierra Blanca. The group is comprised of four enterprising women who have known each other for over 24 years. This is their first cycle with the Fundación Realidad. Angélica Araceli F. Gutiérrez represents the group. She is 38, and she only finished elementary school. She has two children, a girl and a boy. She sells shoes, gifts, bags, and jewelry. She needs the loan to reinvest in bags and gifts. She says that she has a lot of customers to whom she offers an extensive inventory of products. She says that she has been doing this since she was very small. It improved her parents’ quality of life, and now it is improving the quality of life for her children and her husband. Mónica M. Marrón also belongs the the Violetas group. She is 41, and she went to high school. She only has one daughter. Mónica sells Mary Kay brand beauty products. She will invest the loan in these products. She says that they have generated earnings, which improve day to day. Her customers are convinced that it is a good product, and this business helps her get to know more people. Victoria F. C. sells tacos. She wants the loan to restock the raw materials to make her tacos. Lilia Hernández Álvarez is the name of the last member. She sells brand name perfumes. She says that it is a big help because she likes having her own income and being able to give her daughter a good education. She will use the loan to reinvest in perfume. They are all very grateful to the people at Kiva who are helping them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Footwear orders

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal D. "Suma Sartawi" (comenzaremos bien!!) trabaja en el Centro Focal D. Villa Exaltación.  Esta compuesto por doce entusiastas mujeres y un varón, que está aprendiendo a convivir con el grupo.  Los negocios D. las socias son variados, D. acuerdo a las necesidades D. la zona donD. viven, se pueD. identificar: tiendas D. barrio con productos básicos como pan, arroz, fideo, fósforos, refrescos embotellados, carnicería, puesto D. venta D. golosinas a la puerta D. un colegio, venta D. ropa, atención D. una peluquerìa, taller D. costura, hilado en lana D. vicuña y elaboración D. cuadros artesanales.

La elaboración D. cuadros artesanales, es el negocio D. la señora Lidia C. Q., mujer jóven y bastante amable, D. 23 años D. edad. Ya participo D. un ciclo en la asociación y desea nuevamente renovar su crédito para comprar más lana D. alpaca y lana D. colores para tejer los cuadros artesanales que son su sustento.  

Estos cuadros representan imágenes D. montañas, llamas, iglesias, personas, mercados populares, la Señora Lidia asegura que se pueD. reproducir en el tejido, cualquier imágen. Ella comenta que fue su cuñada quien le enseñó a tejer y que ha podido aprender lo suficiente como para crear sus propios diseños. 
Esta casada, tiene dos hijos, una niña y un varón, por ahora piensa que es el número adecuado y que D. acá en adelante se dedicará a trabajar.
texts.en:
The communal association known as "Suma Sartawi" (we will begin well!!) works in the Focal Center of Villa Exaltación. The group is composed of twelve enthusiastic women and one man, who is learning to get along with the group. The associates have various businesses, according to the needs of the zone where they live. Among these are neighborhood stores with basic products as bread, rice, noodle, matches, and bottled refreshments, a butcher shop, a stall selling snacks at the door of a school, clothing sales, a movie theater, a dressmaking workshop, spinning wool yarn from vicuna and making craft pictures. The making of craft pictures is the business of Señora Lidia C. Q., a young woman of 23 years who is very kind. She has already completed one loan with the association and desires again to renew her loan to buy more alpaca wool and colored wool for weaving the craft pictures that are her living. These pictures represent images of mountains, flames, churches, people, and popular markets. Señora Lidia assures us that she can reproduce any image in the weaving. She tells us that her sister-in-law taught her to weave and that she has been able to learn enough to create her own designs. She is married and has two children: a girl and a boy. For now she thinks that is enough and that from now on she will be dedicated to work.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for various businesses, including wool for weaving craft pictures.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
Libertad, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en el Distrito D. Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 65 años, es madre D. siete hijos que son independientes, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien le ayuda en la atención D. su negocio. Libertad forma parte del Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, desD. hace 5 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que fue invertido en productos para su bodega.
Actualmente cuenta con otro negocio, brinda servicio D. Internet.
Con este crédito D. 2500 soles, comprará computadoras para su negocio D. cabinas D. internet.
La meta D. Libertad es ampliar su bodega y adquirir mas computadoras para su cabina D. internet.
texts.en:
Libertad is a very enterprising woman. She lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 65 years old and the mother of seven children that are independent. She is dedicated to administering her convenience store. She carries out this activity in her house. She counts on the support of her husband, who helps her in running her business. Libertad has been part of the Supportive Women Communal Bank for 5 years. The first loan that she received was of 300 soles which was invested in products for her store. At present she also relies on another business: that of offering internet service. With this loan of 2500 soles, she will buy computers for her internet service business. The goal of Libertad is to expand her store and to acquire more computers for her internet service.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy computers for her internet service.

loans.name: Sergio Oldemar

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio Oldemar G. B. es cliente de CEPRODEL desde Marzo del 2008 donde ha trabajado 3 créditos con nuestra institución. Los que ha utilizado para invertir en la mejora de su casa. 

En todos estos  dos años ha demostrado ser un buen cliente. Con un buen record crediticio. El trabaja en la Empresa Lidya Ludic Nicaragua S.A ocupando el cargo de Técnico Supervisor de Máquinas Tragamonedas.

El tiene 40 años de edad, casado y con 3 personas a su cargo, sus dos hijos y su esposa el habita en la zona de Sábana Grande, en la parte occidental de la capital. 

El está agradecido con CEPRODEL y espera seguir trabajando con nuestra institución, ya que le gusta el trato humano que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Sergio has been a client of CEPRODEL since March of 2008 and has had three loans through our institution, which he used to make improvements to his home. In all these years he has proven himself to be a good client with a good credit record. He works as a technical supervisor of slot machines for the Lidya Ludic Nicaragua S.A company. He is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He lives on the west side of the capital, in the Sábana Grande zone. He is very grateful for CEPRODEL and would like to continue to work with our institution because he likes the personal treatment that he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, es una mujer muy responsable, vive en el Distrito D. Calleria, región  Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es madre D. tres hijos y dos dependen D. su cuidado, ella se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y también D. manera ambulante, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que trabaja en la Municipalidad. Rosario forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres solidarias”, desD. hace 4 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra D. un tablero para golosinas, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1200 soles, que será invertido en la compra D. productos D. plástico como: jarros, baldes, bandejas, vasos, etc.
La meta D. Rosario es tener una pequeña tienda donD. pueda vender diversos productos.
texts.en:
Rosario is a very responsible woman. She lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 51 years old and the mother of three children, two of which depend on her for their care. She is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics. She carries out this activity in house house and also door to door. She counts on the support of her husband who works in the city hall. Rosario has been part of the "Supportive Women" Communal Bank for 4 years. The first loan that she received was of 300 soles, which was invested in the purchase of a showcase. Now she needs a credit of 1200 soles, that will be invested in the purchase of plastic products such as: pitchers, buckets, trays, glasses, etc. The goal of Rosary is to have a small store where she can sell diverse products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic products such as pitchers, glasses, trays, etc for her store.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: María Josefa L. A., tiene 41 años de edad tiene 4 hijos, ella tiene una tienda (venta de consumo diario) vende: golosinas, dulces, galletas, también vende algo de libreria como; cuadernos, lapices, lapiceros, etc. Tiene el negocio en su casa y solicita este crédito para comprar mas producto para surtir su tienda, también en la misma tienda tiene una tortilleria. Con este negocio ella mantiene a sus hijos, su sueño es tener una tienda mas grande similar a un deposito y también una librería.
texts.en:
María Josefa L. A. is 41 years of age and has 4 children. She has a store (for the sale of convenience items) where she sells: snacks, sweets, and crackers. She also sells office supplies such as notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, etc. She runs the business in her house and requests this loan to buy more products to supply her store. In the same store she also sells tortillas. With this business she maintains her children. Her dream is to have a larger store similar to an general store and also a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Responsable Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Responsable. Tiene 2 integrantes por lo que cada una de ellas realiza diferentes actividades económicas. En el caso de Justina es madre soltera y tiene 47 años con 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de golosinas y refrescos. A pesar de lo difícil que es mantener el negocio es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras y dinámicas del grupo.  Su otra socia Modesta tiene 44 años. Su actividad económica es venta de ropa. Ella dio inicio a su negocio con mucho sacrificio y debido a su muy buena administración ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio pues es una mujer muy responsable. Ellas se han unido con el fin de salir adelante, a pesar de que han tenidos muchos desafíos son muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de las 2 socias es ayudar a sus familias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The supportive group known as Responsible Women consists of 2 members who each carry out different economic activities. In the case of Justina, she is a single mother, 47 years old, with 2 under-age children in her care. Her economic activity is the sale of snacks and refreshments. In spite of the difficulty that she has to maintain the business, she is one of the most enterprising and dynamic women of the group. The other associate, Modesta, is 44 years old. Her economic activity is clothing sales. She began her business with a lot of sacrifice and due to her very good administration she has managed to do well with her business. She is a very responsible woman. They have united in order to do well. In spite of the fact that they have had many challenges, they are very persevering and hard-working. The reason for the loan is for working capital for the purchase of merchandise for their businesses. The dream of the 2 associates is to help their families and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es: Lupita, es una mujer muy jovial, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 22 años, ella se dedica a venta de golosinas, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es soltera. Lupita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Pastaza”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en la compra de golosinas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas. La meta de Lupita es ampliar su negocio  y poner una bodega bien implementada que le permita generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lupita is a very jovial woman. She lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 22 years old and a single woman. She is dedicated to the sale of snacks, an activity which she caries out from her house. Lupita has been part of the "Pastaza" Communal Bank for one year. The first loan that she received was of 300 soles which was invested in the purchase of snacks. Now she needs a credit of 500 soles, that will be invested in the purchase of snacks and carbonated beverages. The goal of Lupita is to expand her business and to put in a well supplied convenience store that will permit her to generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy snacks and carbonated beverages for resale

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Doña Eusebia R., de 38 años de edad, originaria de Tecpán Guatemala, tiene 20 años de casada y tiene 6 hijos, en especial un varón con discapaciadad, y los demas son mujeres, viven a 3 kilometros del municipio, se dedican al destace y venta de pollo, y como complemento tiene a la venta sandalias, este negocio es atendido por la familia. El crédito lo solicita para comprar mas pollo y sandalias y asi poder ampliar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Eusebia R., age 38, is a native of Tecpán Guatemala. She has been married for 20 years and has 6 children, including a young man who is disabled, and the rest are women. They live about 3 kilometers from the city. They are dedicated to raising and selling chickens, and as a complement they sell sandals. This business is attended by the family. The loan requested is to buy more chickens and sandals and in this way to be able to expand their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more chickens and sandals for resale

loans.name: Sofía De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Sofía de Jesús G. C. es originaria del departamento de Estelí trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como conserje tiene mas de dos años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo se le otorgo el crédito para la compra útiles escolares de sus hijos ya que no contabá con la suficiente cantidad de dinero para hacerlo y necesitaba el crédito con urgencia
Antes de tener este trabajo ella se dedicaba a hacer otras labores como trabajo de domestica. 

Ella plantea que el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que resolverá el problema de sus hijos y se sentirá satisfecha ya que uno de sus sueños es darle el estudio a ellos y poder contribuir en lo posible a que no les falte nada . Sofía es una madre soltera y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar y vive con sus padres a los que también les brida su apoyo cuando lo necesitan.
 
Este es el primer crédito que Sofía tiene con ceprodel
y espera no quedarlos mal y expresa que estará agradecida y desea seguir trabajado y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Sofía de Jesús G. C. is originally from the Department of Estelí and has been working for the Catholic University School of Tropical Agriculture (UCATSE) as a janitor for two years. Her employment history qualified her for a loan to buy school supplies for her children since she does not have enough money and is in urgent need. Prior to her current job, she held other positions including that of a housekeeper.

Sofía claims the loan will be of great help in resolving her children’s problems and will fulfill her dream of providing them with an education. She tries to contribute wherever possible so that they lack nothing. Sofía is a single mother and has two school-age children. She lives with her parents, who also provide their support when needed.

This is her first loan with CEPRODEL and Sofía expresses her appreciation. She hopes to remain well and continue working so that she can improve the living standards for herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for her children

loans.name: Aidee Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aidée del Socorro Hernández A., tiene 43 años de edad,  vive con sus 5 hijos en edades entre  10 y  21 años  en el Barrio Chapacua de Cartagena,  reconocido por la belleza de sus reinas muy representativo en las fiestas del 11 de Noviembre.  Su negocio es una miscelánea-variedades, que  inició informalmente con la  venta de mercancía a través de guías especializadas de productos empresariales;  hace mas  de cinco años,  cuando conoció a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo e hizo su primer crédito,   compro su primera vitrina para hacer una mejor exhibición de sus artículos; gradualmente fue creciendo e ideó la forma de ofrecer servicios fotocopiados muy solicitados en su comunidad, por eso  con su segundo crédito compró una fotocopiadora, que adicionó a su negocio  y con su utilidad fue pagando el crédito. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $ 1.500.000, el cual invertirá en  la compra de mercancía variada, especialmente productos de belleza, articulos escolares y papelería en general.

Con su actividad independiente y  los créditos recibidos, ha aumentado su capital de trabajo y así mismo el nivel de vida   de su familia; ella ha podido educar a sus cinco hijos y tiene como meta  que todos sean profesionales  y respecto a su negocio quiere seguir progresando adquirir más exhibidores y hacer arreglos locativos.

Aidee considera que no ha tenido problemas significativos, todos los ha resuelto en su momento, pero muchas veces no tiene el efectivo disponible para comprar mercancía  de oportunidad que le hace falta  y  retarda su compra.
texts.en:
Aidée del Socorro Hernández A. is 43 years of age. She lives with her 5 children, ages between 10 and 21 years in the Chapacua de Cartagena neighborhood, known for the very representative beauty of its queens in the festivals of November 11. Her business is the sale of miscellaneous products, that she started informally with the sale of merchandise through catalogs of specialized products. She has run this business for more than five years. When she learned of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and received her first loan, she bought her first showcase in order to better exhibit her articles. Gradually she has grown her business and thought to offer photocopy services in her community. Therefore with the second loan she bought a photocopier, that has added to her business and with its use she has repaid the loan. Currently she is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 pesos (about $800 US), which she will invest in the purchase of various merchandise, especially beauty products, school supplies and paper in general. With her independent activity and the loans received, she has enlarged her working capital and thus improved the standard of living of her family. She has been able to educate her five children and she has a goal that they all become professionals. With respect to her business she wants to continue progressing to acquire more showcases and to make product displays. Aidee considers that she has not had any significant problems. They have all been resolved as they surfaced, but many times she does not have the available cash to buy merchandise which is on promotion that she lacks and her purchase is delayed.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise for resale such as beauty products, school supplies and paper

loans.name: Maria Elpidia

texts.es: La Señora Maria Elpidia tiene la edad de 47 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan  por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos para su hogar, esto le ha permitido tener ingresos para su familia, al inicio fue muy difícil ya que no tenía la experiencia necesaria en este trabajo, pero con el paso del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia que necesitaba, y así decide seguir adelante con este negocio. Es por eso que ahora solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios y ropa interior. En un futuro le gustaría tener un negocio grande y pagar todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elpidia is 47 years of age. She is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics. For over 6 years she has been dedicated to this business. She began due to the need to obtain a source of income for her home. This has permitted her to have an income for her family. At first it was very difficult since she did not have the necessary experience in this work, but with the passage of time she obtained the experience that she needed, and thus she decides to continue ahead with this business. That it is why she now requests financing destined for working capital for the purchase of perfumes, creams, nail polish, lipstick and underwear. In the future she would like to have a large business and to repay all her quotas.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cosmetics and underwear for resale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer trabajadora y alegre de 43 años, luego de la separación de su pareja vive sola en una habitación alquilada. Tiene 2 hijos que está en la capital del país en busca de un futuro mejor.   

Ella es una persona muy reconocida por la zona donde vive, lo que le ha permitido tener muchos amigos, quienes siempre la apoyan en cualquier negocio que emprende desde hace 20 años. Es así que desde los primeros meses del año 2008 se inició en la venta de dulces y bebidas en un kiosko fuera de la casa de su hermana. Asimismo cuenta que le gusta vender las bebidas fermentadas, típicas de su región, pues son las más solicitadas durante las fiestas, obteniendo ingresos económicos que le permiten vivir cómodamente e incluso terminar de construir su casa propia. Es por eso que para más adelante anhela hacer crecer su negocio e instalarlo en su vivienda para ya no pagar por alquiler y generar más utilidades.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy orgullosa de progresar cada día junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes también son sus amigos; personas responsables, solidarias y comprensivas. Con los dos mil soles que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de dulces y bebidas para implementar su kiosco.
texts.en:
Ana is a happy and hard-working woman of 43 years. After her separation from her husband, she now lives alone in a rented room. She has 2 children that live in the capital of the country in search of a better future. She is a person who is very well known the zone where she lives. This has permitted her to have many friends, who have always supported her in any business that she undertakes for the past 20 years. In the first months of the year 2008 she began to sell candies and beverages in a stand at her sister's house. In addition she likes to sell the typical fermented beverages of her region, which are the most requested during the festivals. With this she obtains an income that permits her to live conveniently and even to finish building her own house. That it is why in the future she wants to grow her business and to install it in her dwelling, so she no longer has to pay rent and can generate more income. This is the fifth loan that she has had with MFP and she is very proud to progress each day along with the members of her communal bank, who are also her friends; comprehensive, supportive, and responsible people. With the two thousand soles that she now requests she will buy a greater quantity of candies and beverages to sell at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise such as snacks and beverages to sell at her food stand

loans.name: Blanca Inés

texts.es:
Blanca Inés C. es dueña de la Lavandería Blanquiset que maneja desde su casa, simultáneamente con la venta de productos de revistas especializadas. Vive en el barrio La Ceiba de Barranquilla, donde vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos entre 24 y 18 años de edad. Está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace más de 10 años, durante los cuales ha visto su negocio avanzar gracias a los créditos de esta organización. Recientemente su hija mayor graduó en la universidad y ahora solicita un crédito de educación para pagar la carrera universitaria de su segunda hija en enfermería superior. Aprecia mucho la educación de sus hijos y está buscando la manera de apoyar al más joven que está todavía a su cargo. Con este fin, se mudó al barrio La Ceiba porque siente que en un barrio de mejor ambiente familiar y más prosperidad, así que la gente es más estudiosa y son un muy buen ejemplo.
Antes trabajaba en una casa de familia a cuyo dueño lo contrataba una empresa para lavar ropa. Gradualmente el señor no pudo responder y por el comportamiento de Blanca la hicieron cargo de esta actividad. Luego se independizó y abrió su propia lavandería, donde comenzó con una lavadora de uso personal que le regaló su esposo. Durante más de diez años en la lavandería con la ayuda de la Fundación, el negocio le ha dado para comprar otras dos lavadoras, por eso se siente agradecida con la Fundación por la ayuda que le ha otorgado; a nivel personal su negocio le ha proporcionado  independencia y ahora se siente más segura de sí misma.
texts.en:
Blanca Inés C. owns the Blanquiset laundry which is located in her home. She also sells products from specialized catalogues. She lives in Barranquilla's La Ceiba neighborhood with her husband and three children, who range in ages from 24 to 18. She has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for over 10 years. During this time she has seen her business grow thanks to the loans from this organization. Recently, her eldest daughter graduated from university and she is now requesting funding to pay for her second daughter's university education in the field of nursing. She highly values education for her children and is looking for ways to provide for her youngest, who is still under her charge. This is the reason why she moved to the La Ceiba neighborhood because it's more family oriented and more prosperous so the residents there tend to be more studious and set a good example. She used to work in a private home, the owner of which worked for a laundry service. Gradually, he began to fall short of expectations and, because of Blanca's behavior, she was asked to take over the business. Later on, she became independent and opened her own laundry which she started with a home washing machine that her husband gave her. Over these ten years, with help from the Fundación, the business has produced enough to buy two more washing machines. She is grateful to the Fundación for the help it has given her. On a personal level, her business has provided her with independence and now she feels more sure of herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's college education.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 34 años, es una mujer que se siente realizada al estar casada con José, de 40 años. Ambos viven junto a sus 3 hijos: Eduardo de 17, Frits de 14 y Cristian de 11 años, en su casa propia, heredada por los padres de ella.

Desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda de comestibles, y lo que más le gusta es atender a los niños y escuchar sus risas y conversaciones. A su vez, instaló un centro de llamadas, pero la dificultad que tiene es que cuando se va la señal (trabaja por Internet) tiene que reiniciar todo sistema, por suerte cuenta con la ayuda de sus dos hijos mayores. Para ella, su bodega es una manera de relajarse, se siente muy contenta al estar en contacto directo con las personas y poder servirles; además le genera buenas ganancias económicas, las cuales está ahorrando para el futuro, pues su hijo mayor desea estudiar medicina y sabe que es una carrera profesional cara.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota para no defraudar y desmerecer el trabajo de su banco comunal. Hace algunas semanas Edith viene asistiendo a las ferias semanales en su ciudad, por eso, con los mil doscientos soles que solicita aprovechará la oportunidad y comprará grandes cantidades de zapatos y zapatillas para vender en estas ferias.
texts.en:
Edith is 34 years old and married to 40 year old Jose. They live in their own home, inherited from her parents, with their three children: Eduardo, age 17; Frits, age 14; and Cristian, age 11. For the past two years she has been selling food. What she likes the most is serving children and listening to their conversations and laughter. She started a call center, but she had difficulty maintaining a signal (it worked through the Internet), so she needs a new system. Fortunately, she can count on the help of her two oldest sons. For her, her shop is a way to relax. She is happy to be able to work with and help people. It also provides a good income, which she is using to save for the future. Her oldest son wants to be a doctor and she knows that establishing this career is expensive. This will be her second loan though MFP and she promises to make her payments on time so as not to defraud or degrade the communal bank’s work. A few weeks ago, Edith was working at the weekly fairs held in her city. She wants to take advantage of this and will use the 1,200 PEN ($425) to buy shoes and flip-flops to sell at the fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients for her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una persona emprendedora con muchos sueños por delante, tiene 48 años, es madre de 4 jóvenes, pero vive sólo con uno de ellos, Raúl de 20 años.
Alcanzar sus objetivos, siempre fue el motor para emprender un negocio, ella se considera una mujer “mil oficios”. Desde hace 12 años es coordinadora y vendedora de los eventos organizados por una empresa de bebidas; también comercializa productos de belleza de diferentes marcas y los fines de semana alquila su casa como recreo turístico, donde ofrece comidas típicas. A su vez, como estudió técnica en enfermería trabaja en las campañas de salud con el centro médico de su zona. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de sí misma y está satisfecha con sus logros, porque sus ventas y su capital se incrementan. Por tal motivo, para el futuro piensa construir la parte delantera de su vivienda e instalar una botica para vender fármacos especialmente a las personas de bajos recursos económicos o a quienes más lo necesitan, pues asegura que “en la vida no todo es ganar, también tenemos que servir para los demás”.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, siendo ella la presidenta de su banco comunal y quien motiva a sus socias a seguir ahorrando y realizando actividades para hacer crecer sus utilidades grupales. Ahora Gladys quiere emprender un nuevo negocio, por eso con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita comprará sandalias y polos para comercializarlos en las ferias semanales que se desarrollan en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Gladys is an enterprising person with lots of dreams to fulfill. She is 48 and has four children. But, she only lives with one of them, 20 year old Raúl. Reaching her objectives has always been the driving force to undertake a business. She considers herself to be a woman of “1,000 jobs”. For 12 years she has been the coordinator and salesperson for organized events for a drink company. She also sells different brands of beauty products. On the week ends she rents her house as a tourist attraction, and she sells typical foods. She studied to be a nurse technician, and she works on the health campaigns with the medical center in her area. She is very proud of herself, and she is happy with her achievements because her sales and her capital have increased. That is why, in the future, she plans to build in front of her house and set up a pharmacy to sell medicine. She will sell especially to people with low economic resources or those who need it the most. She says, “In life everything is not about getting, we also have to help others”. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is the president of her communal bank, and she motivates its members to keep saving and working to make their group’s profits grow. Now Gladys wants to undertake a new business. To do so, she will use the requested 1,500 PEN to buy watermelons and polo shirts. She will sell them at the weekly fairs that take place in her city.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business

loans.name: Glidy

texts.es:
Glidy es una mujer muy alegre y decidida de 25 años y está felizmente casada con Juan, de 41 años. Tienen 2 hijos; Hatsumi de 7 años y Loana de 2 meses de nacida. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada a orillas del río San Ramón en la selva central del Perú.

“Café caliente” es la orquesta musical que Glidy y su esposo tiene desde hace 6 años. Esto es un esfuerzo conjunto, pues ambos son los directores, fundadores y promotores, y ella es quien canta. La música es la pasión que esta familia comparte, puesto que los dos se dedican íntegramente a hacer cada día mejor las cosas, debido a que las ganancias cubren las necesidades domésticas y pueden tener una adecuada calidad de vida.
Es así que para el futuro piensa comprar más equipos de sonido e instrumentos musicales, para conformar otro grupo.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ante los miembros de su banco comunal se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota, pues desea continuar accediendo a créditos futuros. En mutuo acuerdo con su esposo, con el dinero que Glidy solicita decidieron comprar dos parlantes para implementar su equipo de sonido.
texts.en:
Glidy is a happy and dedicated woman. She is 25 years old and happily married to 41 year old Juan. They have two children, 7 year old Hatsumi and 2 month old Loana. This family lives in their own home located in along the San Ramon river in Peru’s central jungle. “Café Caliente” (Hot Coffee) is the name of the musical group that Glidy and her husband have had for the past six years. This is a joint effort, as they are the directors, founders, and promoters, and she is the singer. The music is the passion that this family shares and both of them dedicate themselves to doing things better each day. Their earnings cover the household expenses and they can have an adequate quality of life. In the future they would like to buy more sound equipment and musical instruments in order to form another group. This will be their first loan through MFP and she makes the promise, to its members, to repay on schedule, as she would like to obtain additional loans in the future. With her husband’s agreement, Gildy will buy two loud speakers to add to their sound equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loud speakers

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 40 años y está separada de su pareja. Con él tuvo 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con una de ellos, Joselin de 15 años.
Su vida siempre estuvo recargada de trabajo, logros y decepciones, que la convirtieron en una persona luchadora y optimista. Desde hace 20 años vende comida en un puesto de un mercado de la ciudad, donde cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y paralelamente comercializa productos fabricados a base de plástico. Ambas actividades que le permitieron educar a sus hijos y brindarles lo mejor, al no tener que pasar necesidades.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es ser atenta con los clientes para que regresen, pues considera que es una estrategia que nunca falla. Por tal motivo, viene ahorrando para que más adelante pueda implementar en su vivienda una tienda de plásticos y ya no tener que ofrecer su mercadería caminando o en las ferias de su zona.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está más que feliz porque ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal y le agrada mucho. Para cumplir con sus planes, con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará variedad de productos plásticos para incrementar sus ventas y seguir ahorrando para su futura tienda.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a very hard working woman, she is 40 years old, and is seperated from her partner. She his three children with him, but only she lives with them. Joselin is 15 years old. Her life was always increasing work, achievements and disappointments, that converted her into an optimistic and successful person. For twenty years, she has sold food in a market stall in the city, where with the help of her mother she also sells manufactured products made from plastic. Both activities permit her to educate her children and bring them a better life, although never beyond the necessities. The thing she likes best about her work is being attentive to her clients so that they return, which she considers a strategy that never fails. For this reason, she has been saving so that in the future she can implement in her house a store of plastics, and so that she no longer has to offer her merchandise walking or in the market zone. This is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and she is more than happy because she already knows the methodology of work of her communal bank and pleases her a lot. In order to complete her plans, with the money that she is asking for now, she will buy a variety of plastic products in order to increase her sales and continue saving for her future shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola es una joven de 20 años, vive con Julio, de 22 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la selva central peruana.

Ella es consiente de que ser madre es un reto muy difícil, más no imposible. Por eso, junto a su esposo, desde hace 5 años se dedican a la venta de frutas regionales. De esta labor lo que más le gusta es ir a las chacras para comprar los frutos, pues se distrae mucho al caminar, por otro lado le molesta tener que insistir en la cobranza a los deudores quienes sacan fruta de su establecimiento al crédito. “Mi negocio es rentable porque puedo comprar mis electrodomésticos para vivir cómodamente, puedo solventar los gastos domiciliarios sin problema y hasta ahorrar para alguna eventualidad “, comenta Paola. A la vez que refiere que para el futuro piensa comprar un camión para trasladar su mercadería a diferentes lugares del país, así ser convertiría en una distribuidora mayorista de fruta.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y le parece interesante la modalidad de trabajo de su banco comunal, donde piensa participar activamente para aprender más del trabajo en equipo. Los 700 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de variedad de frutas oriundas de la zona, las cuales encajonará para que estén listos para la venta.
texts.en:
Paola is a 20 year-old young woman that lives with Julio, whom is 22 years old, and with whom she has an 8 month-old baby. They live in their own house which is located in the central Peruvian forest. She realizes that being a mother is a big challenge but not an impossible one. As such, she, alongside her husband, have dedicated themselves for the past 5 years to the sale of regional fruit. What she likes most about this job is going to the small farms to purchase the fruit, but what bothers her is having to ask those that she has lent credit to at her establishment to re-pay their debts. "My business is profitable because I can comfortably buy the appliances that I need, I can pay off my household bills without any problems, and I can even save a little in case of an emergency, " comments Paola. For the future, she plans on buying a truck so that she can move her merchandise to different parts of the country. She would then convert to being a whole-sale fruit distributor. This is the first loan that she has with MFP and she finds the functioning of her communal bank to be interesting. She plans to participate actively in her communal bank in order to learn more about team work. She will invest the 700 soles that she is applying for in the purchase of a variety of fruits native to the area, which she would then box and have ready to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Mailyn is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Mailyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Mailyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mailyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This will be the third loan taken out by Mailyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie P. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 27 years old. Marjorie is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Marjorie owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marjorie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marjorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Marjorie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix M. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Felix is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Felix owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felix joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Felix is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Felix from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo A. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 40 years old. Danilo is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Danilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide his service. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Danilo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Pith's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is comprised of four people who all live in Preaek Louk village in Kandal province. Mr. Pith S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members; they will use their loans for different purposes. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to support his family, and his wife, Mrs. Preak Boung, is a housewife.

This family has some problems because their house is dark at night and it does not have fresh water to use. Thus, Mr. Pith S. decided to ask for a loan to buy electricity supplies. He would like to buy a hose to provide water for his house with the remainder of the loan. He is a father of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy electricity supplies and a hose for water

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth A., age 46, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has six children. She sells gasoline and coffee at her house, earning approximately an income of US$ 7 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2009. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning US$ 5 per day.

The standard of living of her family has been improved since they have these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. A. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to buy motorbike spare parts for her husband's business and more gasoline to expand her current business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more gasoline and motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Elizabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao V., age 44, is widowed and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of vegetables at a local market in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 7 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2001.

The standard of living of her family has been improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her vegetable produce. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike with a trailer attached

loans.name: Them

texts.en:
Them C., age 36, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of dessert at a local market in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 6 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2008. Her husband is a parachute soldier based in the city, earning an income of US$ 2 per day.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more ingredients to aid her dessert shop. With any remainder, she wants to make improvements to her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more ingredients for the dessert shop

loans.name: Mr. Oem Noem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has twenty-one people who all live in Prey Totueng village in Kandal province. Mr. Oem N. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they will use their loans for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Van Phom, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to support their family.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Oem N. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding; with any remainder of the loan he would like to buy pig feed. He is a father of three children, one of whom is a worker in a garment factory, while the others are farmers.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van V., age 55, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in a business selling porridge and Cambodian traditional cakes at her home, earning approximately an income of US$ 3.50 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 1980. Her husband is a retired officer.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy a motorbike and a machine to squeeze sugar cane juice to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy a motorbike and a machine to squeeze sugar cane juice

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem S., age 57, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business preparing flowers at home for an organization, earning approximately an income of US$ 2 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2008.

Her husband is a cycle driver for people in the city, earning an income of US$ 2 per day. The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more flowers for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. (S. is preparing flowers with her daughter.)

loans.use: buy more flowers for resale

loans.name: Shen

texts.en: Mr. Shen L. is a villager in Preak Doung village in Kandal province and he is 43 years old. He is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to support his family, and his wife, Mrs. Doeurng Yen, owns a general store in the local village. In the rice field, they have some problems because it is infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve rice production, Mr. Shen L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for supporting his rice field. He is the father of two children, one of whom helps the mother to sell groceries, while the other is attending local public school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and  pesticide

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa K., age 30, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in a business selling meatballs in front of a local garment factory in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2008. Her husband helps his wife in the business and is able to earn the same amount of income as his wife.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. K. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to buy more meatballs for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more meatballs to expand the business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., age 38, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of groceries in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2000. Her husband is a construction worker, earning a gross income of US$ 15 per day.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Pastora Tagab Group

texts.en:
Pastora T. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel. She is 56 years old. Pastora is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if that person is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Pastora T.'. Pastora is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Pastora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Pastora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pastora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. They have some problems because the rice field is far from an irrigation system and the soil is infertile. In order to improve rice production, Mr. Vin C. decided to apply for a loan to dig a well. He would like to buy fertilizer and fuel with the rest of the loan. He is the father of a child who is too small to study or work. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Salokhidin

texts.ru: Шахобов Салохидин проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Салохидин разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более 4 лет. До этого он работал мастером в мастерской. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Салохидин хочет приобрести мелкий рогатый скот. Этим он старается увеличить свой доход.
texts.en:
Salokhidin S. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 41 years old; married with 4 children. His wife is a housewife. Salokhidin raises livestock at home. He has been in this business for over 4 years. Before that he worked as a master in a workshop. Salokhidin is requesting the loan to purchase livestock. He wants to purchase sheep and goats. By this he hopes to increase his income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Rolem

texts.en:

Rolem has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chy K. is a villager from Ta Daol Bei Village in Kandal Province. She is 52 years old. She is the mother of four children. One of her children is a security guard and the others attend the local public school. 

Mrs. Chy K. breeds pigs. Her husband, Mr. Sok Kong Srun, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (~3.7-acre) of land on which he grows rice to support his family. They have some problem with their rice field, because the soil is infertile soil and far from an irrigation system. Thus, to improve the productivity of their rice field, Mrs. Chy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. With the rest of her loan, she would like to buy pig food. 

Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel

texts.en:
Agnes is a 40-year-old married woman who has five children in school. She runs a shop while her husband is employed by the county council.  Her business has been running for two years.  She is also employed by the Teacher's Service Commission.  

Agnes as participated as a member of Faulu Kenya by taking loans and she has borrowed two loans in the past. She has requested a loan of Kes.20,000 to add more stock. Her dream is to buy a motorbike and a car in the future. She says that she is very hard-working.

loans.use: To add stock
