loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen P. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 26 years old, is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Maureen owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Maureen has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Maureen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan Maureen has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe T. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married with one school-aged child. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, bar soap for laundry, sardines, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Fe has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Obiya East B Lucy Okello Group

texts.en: Lucy O. is the group representative of this five-member group. She is forty-three years old and married with seven children, all in school. She also cares for three siblings. She owns a retail shop business which she has been operating for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase items to sell, such as sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and so forth. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to invest more in her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria A. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Cesaria is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Cesaria owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cesaria has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Cesaria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cesaria is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Obiya East C Apiyo Concy Group

texts.en: A. Concy is a hardworking businesswoman representing a group of five members. She is 45 years old and married, and she has one child who is enrolled in school. She cares for four additional dependents who are also in school. She deals with a local brewing business and has been running her business for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase millet, charcoal and so forth for her business. She is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase millet, charcoal and so forth for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is a 49-year-old, married woman from the village of Malaubang in Ozamiz City. Veronica has 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Veronica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells snacks, including a local delicacy known as "puto maya," and coffee to her community members. Veronica has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she is hoping to improve her standard of living as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Veronica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Puthea

texts.en: Mrs. Puthea L. is 35 years old and she lives in Ruessei Srok village in Kandal province. She owns a general store in the local village and she is also a tailor. Though she tries to work hard with her businesses, she cannot earn enough income. In order to improve her standard of living and expand her businesses, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell as well as fabric for re-selling. She is a widow and has one child who is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old and operates a butcher shop, and he also sells plastic items. He employs two people. He worked as a driver before he started his current businesses which have been running for four years.  He also earns extra income from farming.   Since he joined Faulu Kenya, which is a partner of Kiva, he is able to meet his financial obligations.  

He previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES, and he plans to take out a loan of 40,000 KES to buy meat, buckets and basins to add to his stock.  He hopes to open another butcher shop in the future.  He dreams of creating employment for ten more people.  He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add to his stock of meat, buckets and basins

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda P. is a 66-year-old woman from the village of Malaubang in Ozamiz City. Rosalinda is separated from her husband and has 5 adult-age children. To earn a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. More specifically, she operates a restaurant, where she serves local foods to customers from her community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she is hoping to improve her standard of living as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for additional working capital. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory and increasing her existing working capital

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en:
Vergilia G. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Vergilia is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Vergilia owns and operates a business selling personal products such as sandals, slippers, beauty products and others in the local community. Vergilia has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Vergilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergilia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is a single, 25-year-old woman from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, in Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Joy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells health and medicinal products to members of her community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to improve her standard of living and her ability to engage in business activities. Joy successfully repaid a prior loan from GDMPC in the amount of 3,500 PHP. Joy is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 6,000 PHP ($150), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Notably, this loan would be the third loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne W. N. is a divorced, 34-year-old woman. She has a 7-year-old child. She notes that she is a very hardworking, humble, and down-to-earth lady. Her business is located at the shopping center in Thika town, near a bus stop. Thika is the region of Kenya known for its pineapple production.

To earn a living, she sells electronics, including bulbs, cables, bulb holders, and sockets. In addition her her electronics-sales business, she also sells goods like popcorn and hand bags. She explains that she has been in the electronics business for one year now and that this business is profitable. Her major challenge, however, is that some of her inventory does not sell too quickly, which is something she has to manage to ensure that the business runs well. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to buy bulbs, bulb holders, sockets, and plugs to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to be an electronics wholesaler, and she also hopes that her son will be educated at the university level.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional electronic goods (e.g., bulbs, sockets, plugs, and cables)

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea S. is 43 years old and she lives in Stueng village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land where she cultivates rice to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Leang Korn, is a fisherman.  They have problems with the rice field because it has infertile soil and a lot of insects, but they don't have money to improve it. Thus, in order to increase her rice harvest, Mrs. Phea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She would like to use the rest of the loan to repair a plowing machine. She the mother of six children, two of whom are farmers, three are attending the local public school, and the last is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ma Jelleza

texts.en:
Ma Jelleza G. is a 35-year-old, married woman from the village of Cabatuan in Ozamiz City. Ma Jelleza has 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Ma Jelleza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. In particular, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells everyday products such as canned goods, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, powder, and toothpaste to members of her community. Ma Jelleza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Ma Jelleza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to improve her family's standard of living and her ability to engage in business activities. Ma Jelleza has successfully repaid a prior loan from GDMPC in the amount of 33,000 PHP. Ma Jelleza is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP ($1,100), which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Notably, this loan would be the fourth loan taken out by Ma Jelleza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business on account of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is primarily comprised of farmers, fishermen/woman, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en: Mrs. Sovan P. is 37 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Hok Keang, are farmers who own two hectares of land for growing rice and vegetables to support their family. They are villagers in Tuol Spueu village in Kandal province. In the rice field, they have some problems. This is the crop growing season, but they don't have enough money to support it. In order to improve the field and produce a better crop, Mrs. Sovan P. decided to ask for a loan to buy ginger plants for growing. With rest of the loan she would like to buy fertilizer and fuel. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda V. is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Criselda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda raises pigs for sale. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Criselda joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criselda successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Criselda is requesting her fourth loan from GDMPC, for 15000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
